product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Pure Simple
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on March 13, 2023
text: I have been using this M&K combo for 2 months now.  Yet to run the included batteries out with daily usage and not turning the units off.  (AA and AAA) batts.  Durability: Don't drop it on the ground.  It has some flex.  Normal usage you're fine.  Noise: Key noise is about average.  On the quieter side of things, but not ultra quiet.  Longevity: Easy to clean, batteries last a good while/easy cheap to replace.  Connectivity: Just plug in and go.  No drivers, no bells and whistles.  Nothing to bloat up your PC  Why I bought it.  And IMPORTANT NOTE.  I use this to run a multimedia/server machine hooked up to my big screen TV.  I'm 7 feet away and don't want to trip over cables.  Don't have a mouse pad either.  The important note is this: Unlike some optical mice, this mouse works well on most surfaces.  So I'm on using the couch beside me to move the pointer about with no issues.  Keyboard is also a comfortable size to type, and to have just sitting beside me on the couch.  Cons: I wish it had a back/side button on the mouse.  It does not.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Good keyboard with one problem
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on March 14, 2023
text: When my 8-year-old K800 finally began to miss keystrokes I started to look for a replacement. The MX Keys stands out but has no buttons for volume and the calculator. It lacks the legs that are used to create a tilt and the notebook-like keys may not be something I want. Clicky keys, found on the G915 and other boards, seem to have a problem with failed keystrokes. I have experienced problems with double-strike keystrokes using the G915.I decided to try out the K270 and was not disappointed. It feels solid and has short-cut buttons. The keys work well, and the combination of keyboard, wrist pad, MX mouse and large mat looks impressive. I have used the keyboard for over nine months.The problem with the keyboard concerns power control. I have two displays and wanted the PC button to turn them off without putting the computer to sleep. Unfortunately, the keyboard itself causes the displays to start back up after about 5 minutes. An old, corded keyboard I tested does not do this and a thorough check of wake timers did not help. The button is now used for sleep mode.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: great set, until it stops working properly
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on March 15, 2023
text: I am going back and forth between the office and home to work. This is a great set for this as I have a similar set up in both offices with a riser for my laptop. Having one dongle for both the keyboard and mouse frees up the few USB ports for other items I may need to connect. After about 4 months, I noticed the mouse was getting sluggish on occasion. It was not as responsive as it first was, I replaced the battery. I was hoping to get a longer battery life from the mouse, I do turn it off when it travels so buttons are not pushed wasting the battery life. I read other reviews saying use a mouse pad, I have one in both places. Unfortunately, the mouse is very laggy and is not always very responsive to movement. The keyboard has no trouble and after about 6 months is still working perfect, no issues. I just wish the mouse would work better. Tried to find support through Lenovo, the store purchased from and I am having trouble finding their customer support information.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Very basic but trouble free.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on April 9, 2023
text: Doesn't rely on the unifying receiver and it's buggy software so this is a very stable platform. No worries about interference from Wi-Fi or other devices in the vicinity. It's a really bare bones keyboard and mouse so if you're looking for fancy features like the back lighting RGB lighting or any of that kind of thing look somewhere else. If you want a basic keyboard and mouse that seems to be pretty much bulletproof you can't go wrong here.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: The USB dongle is attach to the lid of the box.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on March 17, 2023
text: I was looking for something small and semi portable to be used in my kitchen when I want to step away from the office. This set was perfect for that because it’s as small as it’s going to get for a full-size keyboard.  The mouse is also very small, somewhat uncomfortable to use if you need it for long hours. I wish it was a bit bigger and more ergonomic.Pro tip: I was looking for the usb dongle inside the battery bay of the mouse where is typically stored, but it wasn’t there. I thought they forgot to include one and was preparing to box it back up for a return then notice it was attach to the lip of the box.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: So frustrating!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on March 27, 2023
text: I normally like Logitech products.  I ordered the MK270 keyboard and mouse.  The mouse works okay but the keyboard has been sporadic and now doesn't work at all.  I've put in new batteries and just purchased another USB Unifying Receiver.  Nothing works.  Before it died, it would sporadically accept typing and then would pause and then rush the typing leaving out letters.  I will never purchase another Logitech wireless keyboard.  From other reviews, it doesn't sound realistic to try to contact Logitech if you only get a bot and then are put on hold for a long period of time.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: No click-clack here!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on March 31, 2023
text: I did due diligence between three keyboard (KB) mouse (M) combo….we found a winner! Very simple to set up and link both KB & M to your device. Less than 15 seconds. Bonus: aaa energizer batteries included for both items! Zero lag time when typing or pointing. KB very quiet yet satisfying. Scroll Wheel on M is quick.Both items have auto sleep features that work when inactive for an extended period of time.***NOT A PAID REVIEW*** NOT A ROBOT ***- You’re Welcome

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Decent layout, good range, find the USB connector in one side of the box!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on February 19, 2023
text: I have used 2 of these units...The initial challenge is that the USB wireless adapter is easy to miss... it was in a side of the box next to a side flap, but nothing on the box said "open this side" or made that side seem special at all.  If you open the other side of the box, you can get the keyboard, mouse, and paperwork and never find the USB adapter.  There is a spot to keep the adapter inside the mouse (inside, past the bottom cover), but that's not where the adapter was during shipping.During use, this set has great performance at the ranges I have used.  I have used it with a projector with about 15 feet of distance from the receiving PC.  I have also played games on a different computer using one of these sets.  The keys may not have the response or feel that gamers may want, but this set works.  I have not had issues with pressing multiple keys at the same time games.  (Key rollover... problems occur on some other keyboards with combinations such as Shift+W+A... easily caused by running forward and to the left in a game.  This keyboard has not had any key combination problems so far.)

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Functions great, not as many button options as I would like.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on April 8, 2023
text: This keyboard/mouse combo works perfectly, no observable lag, it’s accurate with no missed key strikes. My only complaint is the mouse doesn’t have any extra buttons, only the standard left click/right click/middle wheel button and while the keyboard does have a start/pause button and volume control, it’s missing the next/previous buttons. It’s not a deal breaker for me at all, just would have been nicer.The most important thing is that it works, and this does well.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Bulletproof
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on March 12, 2023
text: Recommended by a knowledgeable friend, I needed something to replace my aging Logitech G-15 that was more than 12 years old. Keyboard has a great feel. The mouse is smaller than what I'm used to, but I'm now used to it, and it also works great too. Only problem I had was, it was shipped in its original box without a protective Amazon box around it. Box was in rough shape, but product was fine. One flap was torn completely off. Good thing it wasn't the flap holding the USB transmitter. If possible, get it shipped inside an Amazon box, just in case.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: A Solid Wireless Keyboard and Mouse Combo
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on January 18, 2023
text: It's pretty hard to go wrong with Logitech computer products. This is very much the case with this wireless keyboard and mouse combo, specifically model MK270, with 2.4 GHz. It took me less than five minutes to set this combo up. It was well protected in packaging, however, it was also easy to unpackage with a USB receiver that is small and frees up desk space.I use this same model at work. So, when I got to the point of needing a new combo at home it was a no-brainer to turn to Logitech again. This offers a full-size keyboard with a somewhat compact mouse that is comfortable and easy to use. This isn't a high-tech Logitech combo - so, I'm not sure that hardcore gamers would be happy with it but for most productivity needs it should work absolutely fine.The mouse is designed to work for both right and left-handed folks. The cursor is smooth and effective.I like the tilt legs with the keyboard. The keyboard is designed for 36-month battery life. The mouse is designed for 12-month battery life. Both offer on/off switches. Initial batteries were included.This combo has a 10-meter range and that's accurate (I tested it). It's compatible with Windows 10, 11 or later along with Chrome OS. The combo has a three-year limited warranty.This is really a very solid wireless keyboard and mouse combo. I've seldom been disappointed with Logitech products and that's true here. This perfectly meets my needs and is a great combination of great quality and value.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Plug and Play

text: At first, I thought that the keyboard was not a full-size keyboard but it is and very lite weight.  Basically, I plugged in the device to my USB and it started to work right away.  No need for instructions.  I haven't tested the distance but i love eliminating two more wires.  Mouse takes some getting used to because I have large hands but other than that, I would recommend.  I purchased two - one for my home office and the other for my off-site office.Now to remember to turn off to save the battery.

title: Inexpensive keyboard, works well enough
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2022
text: Got this as a replacement for the ones they give us at work because I was tired of dealing with the cord when using my adjustable height desk. I have loved having the freedom to move it around and raise and lower my desk without the aggravation of pinching the cord or being unable to move it off my nearest work surface.  The mouse has worked pretty much flawlessly for me, I don't think I've had a single issue despite having dropped it on the floor more than once.  It is a basic design, nothing fancy, no extra buttons or ergonomic features, but just as good as the wired mouse I had previously.The keyboard is where it loses some points.  I would probably give the mouse 5 stars and the keyboard only 3 stars, while it works pretty well something like 95-99% of the time, there are instances when it just won't respond.  I will type and nothing appears, sometimes it is just delayed, and sometimes what I am typing never shows up at all until I close out of everything, turn off the keyboard power and turn it back on and it finally gets going again.  Interestingly it will sometimes work in one program but not another at the same time.I appreciate having the standard 10-key and the quick buttons up top, for instance I use the calculator button frequently.  I have also been pleased with the battery life, as of this writing I've had the keyboard for over 10 months and don't recall needing to ever change the battery. I expect it to last much longer, and while I don't think it is unusual for wireless keyboards to last for a long time on one battery, I do appreciate that it isn't sitting there draining power needlessly.

Comes with the first batteries already installed. When you're done using set the slide to off. Mouse works on just about any surface, hard or soft, and the keyboard has excellent range if you're casting your screen. What's more, its really affordable. Dare I say, best bang for your buck.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Works well for the price
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2022
text: For $20 it works as needed for a work mouse and keyboard. I would like to expand upon the rating sections “gaming” and “sleep mode.” For gaming it’s an absolute no-go. If you want to be able to do anything in games without having to worry about input delay or pressing keys twice, this is not the keyboard. As for sleep mode, I had to give it a 2 out of 5 because I’m not sure how well it works. I’m not sure when it goes to sleep because there is no indicator on it, however it does have really good battery life!Overall I would still give it a 4 out of 5 because it’s a great keyboard for a work setup and great for storing out of the way when you don’t need it. It’s also small enough that you can easily take in on the go with you.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: You may need a USB extender cable
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2022
text: Had trouble with lag in both the keyboard and mouse after installing.  After an hour of internet research, made irritatingly slow by the glitching mouse and keyboard I finally determined that the wireless connection was intermittent when the dongle was inserted into the front USB port on my intel NUC only 3 feet from the keyboard and mouse. When I connected it to a 3 ft. USB extender cable the problem vanished.  Interestingly enough, when I moved the keyboard and mouse 8 ft. away from the new set up they still worked fine. It must be RF interference from the NUC.  I've always had good service from Logitech products in the past so this was surprising. A previous Logitech mouse did not give me any problems with the dongle connected to the NUC so go figure.

title: Great Keyboard. Mediocre Mouse
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on November 29, 2022
text: The keyboard is perfect for your everyday office or home PC needs. Nothing too crazy. It's a basic full keyboard with 2 legs to angle. Sturdy construction and relatively quiet keystrokes. I love the keyboard.The mouse? It's a piece of junk. It's a Logitech M185 model. Looks great but it so fragile compared to my Logitech M325 mouse. The M185 feels like a cheap toy or knock off mouse made of thin plastic that would break if you so much as squeezed your hand. Horrible quality.I am keeping it as an emergency backup since it runs off the same USB dongle as the keyboard, but I'm going to keep using my existing M325 for as long as it works....I've had it for well over 3 years now. I've dropped my M325 a few times too and it keeps going. The M185 feels like it would break apart the first time it hits the floor.All that said....The price was right for $19.99 and the keyboard was the main thing I needed, so I am still happy.The mouse is why this is not a 5 star review.

title: Great keyboard, but had to get a little creative to get good wireless reception
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on December 4, 2022
text: For only 20 bucks on sale, I love this keyboard/mouse combo! perfect size and key layout that I'm used to. The middle of the keyboard flexes a litte when pressing the space bar, not a big deal. Great rubber feet on the bottom to keep it from slipping. The biggest issue for me was constant lag and freeze when using the keyboard and I almost returned it. I tried plugging the USB receiver into ports on the front, top and rear of my dell desktop and it didn't really make a difference. I found a Youtube video that showed a guy using a USB extentsion cable, running it away from his computer and then plugging the USB receiver into the cable. This worked for me and the keyboard has zero lags/freezes now! The mouse works fine, but is a little smaller than the standard size I like, but I'll get used to it.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Excellent price, but it is low quality.  USB Receiver has very small range.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2022
text: This is a very cheap keyboard and mouse.  I got what I paid for.  My rating is based on quality, not cost.  It is a good keyboard for the price, but it does not come close to the quality of keyboards that cost a little more.  That is why I give it 3 stars.  I do not use my desktop often, so I did not want to spend a lot of money on a new keyboard.  I can live with this keyboard and mouse, but if I were purchasing for a desktop that I used often, then I would recommend buying a better quality keyboard and mouse, that will most likely cost more money.First the USB receiver is not good.  They claim 33 feet, but that is if there is absolutely nothing in the way.  I had it plugged into the back of my desktop computer beside my desk 3 feet from the keyboard and the keyboard would not work.  The mouse did work fine.  I plugged the receiver into the front of the desktop so that it would be in front of the desk and there were many dropouts and delays.  Finally, I plugged in a USB cable so that the receiver would be 2 feet from the keyboard and it worked.  So that is the setup that I will use with this keyboard.  If you have any object between the keyboard and the receiver, you will most likely need to buy a USB cable to bring the receiver closer to the keyboard.Second, the keyboard is very noisy and is not as comfortable as my previous Logitech Keyboard.  The mouse is optical, which is good for a low priced keyboard and mouse, but it is not as smooth as my previous Logitech mouse.My previous Logitech keyboard and mouse did cost about $60 and lasted many years.  It was smooth, comfortable, and quiet.  This $20 keyboard and mouse doesn't come close, but only cost me $20.  So as I said earlier, if you will use the keyboard and mouse often, I would recommend a more expensive, better quality keyboard and mouse.  If you will only use your keyboard and mouse occasionally, then this mouse and keyboard will be fine.

title: Bluetooth was inadequate
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2022
text: This is a good product but the Bluetooth was inadequate for managing my computer at about ten (10) meters. It worked perfectly one meter away, but the description indicated it would provide a good connection up to 33 feet. The manufacturers specification is for ten (10) meters - or about 33 feet.Logitech support was excellent but were only able to suggest electrical interference. I'm not a novice and after much testing I'm of the opinion that no Bluetooth devices at this price point are likely to connect satisfactorily beyond a few feet. This purchase was returned for a refund.

text: This is a great basic wireless keyboard for a really good price. Recommended to me by my programmer son. It's also really easy to keep my fingers on the correct keys, and put them back in the right place after moving my hands away. My typing accuracy and speed have improved a lot since getting this.

title: everything you need in a keyboard and mouse!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2023
text: I don't write too many reviews, but this product is one of the few that is worth it.  This is actually my third keyboard/mouse set that I bought for my workspace setup at home.  Unfortunately, the keyboard is not completely child- or liquid-proof, as the prior keyboards were damaged because of which, but if you can manage your kid to not pull out and lose the keys or keep your coffee or other drinks from spilling over the keyboard, then this is the best keyboard for productivity.  Just a simple design that doesn't take up a lot of space.  The keystrokes feel perfect and not cheap, with all functions that you need.  Really great for an at-home office setup.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Good value
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2022
text: I'm a Logitech user from way back (decades prior to the current Logi branding, if that contextualizes things for you).  This keyboard has a narrower profile than my prior purchases, about as broad as the HP laptop keyboard I'm replacing with it.  I have no complaints about key placement, travel or feel, and I'm currently installing the first game I'll be testing it with, but so far, so good.One thing that threw me when activating the mouse is that there is no visible light emanating from the LED port.  Presumably the mouse uses infrared or some other invisible frequency, but if you're like me and are used to seeing a bright red light when the battery is installed, don't be dismayed.  Just try the mouse and go with the flow.

title: Good keyboard, great price
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on December 12, 2022
text: Overall, decent keyboard at a great price.  I wish the typing was a bit softer (required less energy to push the keys), but it's still okay.  The mouse left key in particular is a little stiff.  I really like how both the mouse and keyboard connect to a single USB receiver - frees up one of my USB outlets! :)  (I also love the lack of wires on my desk now - makes my desk so much neater) I also like the volume adjustment buttons on the keyboard.  There's even a shortcut to open Windows' Calculator app (I didn't even know Windows had such an app..haha)Overall, a decent keyboard at a great price - I'd recommend it to others who don't want to spend a lot for a keyboard.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Good keyboard
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on January 1, 2023
text: First- One thing I strongly suggest- be sure to buy a protective cover to go with this keyboard. Only because of the spacing between the keys. It gets dirty quick. I have a tenedency to place my iced tea on shelf above pullout keyboard shelf, so condensation and dripping has ruined past keyboards. (thank goodness I invested in cover). Otherwise this keyboard is great. Can take a pounding! My 9 year old Autistic nephew loves  learning games and tends to get a bit overexcited when he plays them. He hasn't learned to completely control his reactions, thus he will strike the keys too hard. Also, I like the spacing of the keys. Does well for my arthritic hands and fingers. Well worth the low price!

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Great item at a better price...
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on December 4, 2022
text: As others have said, yes the USB plug is in the flap of the box, but honestly that isn't a big deal to me. I worry more about the quality of an item than how it is packed. As for the quality I have had zero problems and the ONLY thing I think I would have done differently is NOT put a power off button on the multimedia button row. Maybe make it a sleep / lock button instead of power off. It just seems to easily as you are learning that section of the keyboards layout. I think I also would make the "legs" a little sturdier as they seem a bit "fragile" but I haven't had any issues with them as of yet. But other than that, I don't know of much I would change so far.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Decent, inexpensive combo. Mouse could use some quality improvement.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2022
text: I've had two of these so far. First set lasted 6 years before the mouse wheel stopped working properly. Second set didn't last 1 year before the left-click mouse button started failing.Biggest layout complaint is that there's a "Shutdown PC" hot key at the top of the keyboard between the email and calculator keys that will force shutdown on a single key press. My computer has been shut off on accident several times because I or something bumped it. You have to download Logitech software to configure the hot keys, but the "Shutdown PC" key was not listed among them. The only work around is to pop the key out of the socket with a knife.

title: Easy Setup and Works Great!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2022
text: I wasn’t sure what to expect. I am incredibly picky about keyboards and hesitated purchasing this online, but I am pleasantly surprised. Setup was quick. It comes with batteries installed which was a plus. I popped the usb into my work desktop and pulled the battery tabs off - everthing worked immediately. The keys have a nice feel to the touch - almost squishy but probably not the right adjective. The keys are quiet which is a must for me. There was also no adjustment period for my fingers. The keys are in their standard placement and not compressed for design. I am please with my purchase and would buy again and definitely recommend.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Wireless, Cheap, and works ok - media control keys are annoying - mouse is small and basic
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2022
text: I've bought several of these and it works fine for what I need and at the right price.  I work from home and tend to operate from my couch with the wireless keyboard laying on my lap + multi-monitor + touch pad and mouse.  This gives me freedom to move the keyboard around my workspace and you get used to the feel in time.  Keys are kind of spongy but otherwise fine.  Most annoying thing about it is when I pick it up with one hand I often accidentally hit the sleep key because the media controls / sleep key bar is so close to the edge they are easy to tap.  I have the keyboard on my lap in use probably at least 8 hours a day or more - even weekends - and it seems to be holding up after at least a year of use - battery seems to last forever.  I like to remove the Shift Lock key entirely from my keyboards and these are at the right price point - no guilt tearing the caps lock off - lol.  I tried the mouse but it's too small for my hands and pretty basic - so I don't use it but good to have a few extras on hand.

title: Get It Now : Can't Beat Price and with 1-Day Delivery
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on November 4, 2022
text: This is the 3rd Logitech MK270 keyboard + mouse combo I've bought in the last 3 years for both home and office computers.  My office keyboard just stopped working.  Checked all the usuals to no avail.  Rather than investigating further and wasting time and productivity, I just ordered another pair which arrived the next day!  Hooray for plug and play.  Shame I'll have to discard the working mouse and bluetooth USB but they seem to only work as preassigned pairs.  Wish Logitech would find a way to reuse them but that's a big problem with today's seeming "planned obsolescence" products - more expensive to re or upcycle?  Had credit on file with Amazon so the $25 minimum order for free shipping did not apply.  Note to Logitech - please move the power button or make it a switchable type so I don't accidentally turn off my pc with a slipped keystroke!  One is once too many.  Ultimately - Recommend !

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: OK but could be better
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on July 27, 2020
text: I liked the idea of having a single dongle to use with a wireless keyboard and mouse combination.  But the mouse has a pretty low-end feel in the hand, and the glides on the bottom are much grittier-feeling than those on the bargain Microsoft wireless mouse I've been using.  The wheel on the Logitech mouse also has sort of a gritty feel to the scroll, while the Microsoft makes a satisfying clicking sound as it ratchets, smoothly, on the scroll.  After about thirty second, I decided not to use the Logitech mouse, but to stick with the Microsoft and two dongles.Now, granted, this is a bargain-basement keyboard and mouse, so, if money's tight, it'll get the job done, but if you can afford better and you're a heavy user of the keyboard and mouse, then this might not be what you want.The keyboard is better than the mouse.  I'm using it to type this review.  But I don't personally like it.  I do like the fact that it has an on-off switch, so if you're planning to be away from your computer for a while, you could turn it off and saver batteries.  It's a little detail, but it's nice to have, and why not?They key placement if fine, but the key travel is much longer than I've gotten used to with my laptop.  That's definitely a personal preference issue, though, so it doesn't say much about whether or not YOU should want this product.I like the fact that the keyboard is no-frills.  I don't want or need an expensive keyboard with precision-engineered keys that make some special sound or have lights in them or behind them.  I want a keyboard that lets me type.  The separate number pad would be important for users who work with numerical data a lot, but its essential for me for one reason only--it allows me to make a long hyphen in Microsoft word by pressing the Ctrl and the "-" key on the numeric keypad simultaneously.  Otherwise, I would probably never use it, but I do use it for that function when I write and make textual references, so I always look for a numerical keyboard, and this keyboard has it.If someone would just design a basic keyboard with that one extra key, I'd probably buy it, though.But for me, the long key travel makes this keyboard a bit cumbersome.  I'll probably get used to it.  I think it's what I was used to once upon a time.  But I also use a laptop, and I've noticed that transitioning from one keyboard to another is actually a big deal, ergonomically.  If you use two different computers, you might want, as I do, to make the two machines feel very much the same to you.  Again, this is especially to be considered if your keyboard is a major part of your experience of using the computer.  For some people, it's not.Now, to be fair, as I type, I'm already adjusting to this keyboard, but I still feel confident that I could find one better suited to me.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Great for price and casual users, a few missing preferences.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on July 1, 2019
text: The keyboard is great. The keys give a satisfying feedback with each keystroke, and it feels sturdy for the price. The main things I dont like are that it's a single reciever for both devices and the mouse is overly sensitive. I have both a laptop and custom PC that I switch between, and because of the unified receiver with this combo, I use a different wireless mouse for the laptop. Sure, I could just connect this one and also have a second keyboard connected to my laptop but why? I understand the unified receiver is probably meant to take up less USB ports, but even most laptops have at least 3 USB ports now. Basic motherboards for custom PCs usually have at least 6, not including what your case may have built in. I know it may fit some nomadic laptop users' needs, but it's just not a desired feature for me.Mostly, though, my annoyance with this set come from the mouse being WAY too sensitive. I don't mean it flies across the page with the flick of my wrist; that's adjustable in the OS settings. Anytime I try to click on something (hyperlinks, buttons, applications, etc.) the mouse is so sensitive that it interprets the small, natural wiggle in my hand as I click as actual movement and typically tries to drag-and-drop or otherwise not register as a generic click. I've had to try to click things up to 5 times before it registered correctly. It's incredibly annoying when it happens. I've tried using a mouse pad and other surfaces to no benefit either. Plus, my other mouse that I use with my laptop does fine on both said laptop and custom PC on all surfaces, including fabric. It's just this mouse.Lastly, the range is mediocre depending on what your setup is like. I use my 55" tv as a monitor and my tower sits on the entertainment center approximately 6 ft away. The receiver does well when plugged into the USB ports on the front of my case, but connection lags terribly if in any of the ports in the back (about another foot back).TL;DR: Great for price, mouse is extra sensitive, single unified USB receiver for both mouse and keyboard, range could be better.Pros:- Great price- Pleasing haptic feedback from keyboard- Battery life (going on 3 months at the time of this review)Cons:- Mouse overly sensitive- Unified receiver for both devices- The range is mediocre- No backlightIn the end, I'll be investing in a new mouse at the very least.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: One thing to look out for if you plan to use with a ComputeStick
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2020
text: This is a typically-good Logitech wireless keyboard and mouse.  I've had several in the past, so not my first appearance in this rodeo.  I've never had a complaint about them, and this isn't a complaint.The unit was purchased to use with an Intel ComputeStick STK1AW32SC I've had lying around for a few years.  I found that there is a great deal of RFI (radio frequency interference) that overwhelms the USB dongle, regardless of what they say about 2.4GHz dropout prevention.  This makes the connection intermittent, and both the mouse and the keyboard are impossible to use.  BUT the problem is easily corrected, and it's not Logitech's fault; I'm sure Logitech was not expecting this unit to be used practically on top of an Atom CPU :)The problem was solved by plugging a 24" USB extension cable into the port on the ComputeStick, and plugging the dongle into the USB extension.  That got it far enough away from the ComputeStick (it's currently lying about a foot away) that there was no longer any problem with RFI.  A similar solution would be to use a USB hub and plug the dongle into the hub.  Given the frequencies involved, my guess is any USB extension cable of at least 6"-12" in length would solve the problem; I just went with the extension I had on hand.I have not tested the unit with the Raspberry Pi, but previous experience with other wireless devices and the Pi suggests this is not an issue (or not as much of an issue) with the "full size" Raspberry Pi.  The dongle won't plug directly into a Pi Zero (no USB A port) so it's a non-issue for the half-size Pi.Again:  No operational issue once I got the dongle a short distance away from the ComputeStick.  Good keyboard/mouse combination; would buy again.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Does not tolerate distance or LOS issues with receiver
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on September 2, 2022
text: While I would be easily ecstatic with this keyboard, it has one near fatal issue that some research has shown is common to this keyboard (not just mine).It is very common for the keyboard to start lagging and drop keys. This is almost always after a period of no activity, so I originally assumed it was a sleep thing, but it can happen fast enough that sleep most isn't the issue. Some research indicates this is a common problem for this model and seems comes up due to signal issues between the keyboard and the receiver (the mouse does not exhibit the problem). Any line-of-sight blockage - even if the receiver is otherwise at very close range - can create the issue, as can transmitting distances as short as 5' or so even if there is no LOS obstruction.Cycling the on/off switch on the keyboard is generally an instant fix - otherwise, you wait it out and see how many characters it dropped. The more lasting fix (other than using a different product) seems to be to have a USB hub that is in LOS and near the keyboard and connect the USB receiver to that.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black

title: Long lasting, high quality keyboard with quick keys and mouse
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on July 28, 2022
text: I can't believe I bought this in 2019.  So far, I've had this keyboard/mouse set for 3 years and it works great!  For a few days, I thought it had finally started to break down because some keys were misfiring, but after a quick clean, it's as good as new.  Before I cleaned the keyboard I tried a couple replacements, but they were a total disappointment:  slow keys and their mouse would randomly shut off like the sleep mode from office worker's hell.  It made me determined to see if this set could be repaired.  Thank all good things and small mercies, because it's back and working good as new.  HIGHLY RECOMMEND!  I didn't realize before how important a reliable keyboard is, but you don't until [you think] it's gone, do you?  Anyway, back to work!

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: "Power" button does nothing, disconnects and/or lags frequently, mouse is tiny
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on January 5, 2023
text: There's a "Power" button in the extra keys at the top, but it won't actually power on the PC.  Tried "Windows 98" mode and "Any Key" mode, does nothing (I have other keyboards that power up fine, so it's clearly a product issue).  I bought 2 of these for my kids new computers, neither one works so I chock it up to a design flaw.Both keyboards disconnect and/or lag frequently...to the point of being unusable.Both keyboards do not work AT ALL with non-OS level software such as USB-booted diagnostics (memtest, etc).  The BIOS screens do recognize them however, but nothing else does w/o the full OS running.The mouse is tiny, not fit for adult hands.  That part is actually a plus for me: These were intended for my kids use and so fit their tiny hands well.  But if I had to use them on my own computer I'd toss them immediately....they're literally 1/3rd the size of my own mouse (also a Logitech).The mouse and keyboard both have their own on/off switches and you must manually turn them off or else replace the batteries frequently.You get what you pay for...and $20 for a wireless keyboard and mouse is asking a lot.  I'm returning these to get Logi's wired version.  I love the company, use a ton of their products including a different wireless keyboard, but this one is just a let down at any price.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Springy keys and excellent response/connection
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on May 1, 2022
text: I do like a responsive keyboard. The keys remind me of some older traditional wired keyboards. So, its not small like my recently destroyed “jelly comb” brand keyboard/mouse combo. I’m ok with that. While I enjoyed the smaller size of my previous keyboard, I was often finding my hand position “off” - at a modest 65 wpm, I did still find myself with a sentence or two of gibberish before looking back and realizing it. 😂The mouse is smallish and I have smaller hands. It is responsive though and the wheel is set at correct scrolling out of the box.I did miss the multi-function keys. Smaller keyboards combine functions and I was not happy with having to share number key functions with “pgup pgdwn” etc. This keyboard has them separate.Set up was quite literally “out of the box”, had batteries in both keyboard and mouse, placed the usb dongle receiver in and 5 seconds of “device driver” and good to go.

text: My old Keyboard had decided after a few years that it wanted a permanent rest."It Was Pining For The Fiords" (100 Bonus points if you get the quote)At first I thought it was my computer, because it would not boot, but after trying an older KB I found what the problem was, batteries that decided to leak.My older KB had a few problems, sticky keys and a very sticky space bar, but it ran enough to show me where the problem was.I ordered the mouse and KB combo  from here for $19.99I just plugged in the New Logitech transmitter/receiver and both the KB and the mouse work great right out of the box.The mouse might be the lightest I have ever had, but it works great, but to be fair I have never had a problem with Logitech items ,well except for burrito crumbs and pop spilled in the KB, but that is on me.I finally learned and keep my pop off to the side and away from the KB.For the price I don't think you can beat the quality

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: You'll forget you ever needed wires.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on August 8, 2021
text: Some years back I tried my first wireless keyboard and mouse. I loved it, but...I'll get to the 'but' next. This combo had no buts. As reliable as any wired I've ever used (and that goes back to the S-100 bus). I've even managed to forget that there are batteries at work here. Since Christmas, 2020 (today it's August, 2021) every day, seven days most weeks, continuous use. Love the keyboard. It likes to go fast! We get along fine. Love the mouse. It doesn't mind going side-to-side, full speed, or going just one pixel at a time.Now I've cursed myself. The batteries are going to die just after I forget they're there. Oh well.Now the 'but's, in case you've been there. Early wireless was full of promise and never quite perfect. I'd type full speed and it would lose an occasional character. I'd mouse a pixel or two and the pointer would jump a pixel or three (or four). Since then (I think that was an 80386) I've suffered with wires. Suffered needlessly. Never again.Oh, yeah. Ratings below. I write programs and English. Don't do games. Don't know how 'sleep mode' relates to keyboard/mouse. When I go into sleep mode, keyboard and mouse wait quietly until I get out of bed. They don't complain. Never ask for coffee. Like good friends.

title: nice combo, but doesn't work with Unifying USB receiver
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on December 23, 2021
text: This is a review of the Logitech MK270 wireless keyboard and mouse.  It's a keyboard!  It's a mouse!  They work right away the way you would expect.  I plugged the USB receiver into my Mac, and they worked right away.For Mac users, the Windows key serves as the Command key.  The appropriate keyboard  keys can control audio volume.Just a heads-up:  I took off a star because the product does not work with Logitech's Unifying USB receiver.  It didn't occur to me that Logitech uses two different USB receivers in its products.  I have a Logitech trackball, and I thought I would be able to use it with the same USB receiver that the keyboard and mouse came with, but no.  Moreover, if I swap in the Unifying USB receiver that came with the trackball, the keyboard and mouse do not work with it.

title: Dongle needs line of site to peripherals
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2022
text: I have a personal and a work laptop. I bought a USB-C hub adapter along with this Mouse/Keyboard combo so that I can plug the dongle and second monitor into the hub and only switch out one connection for all my peripherals. Well, the keyboard was working great, but the mouse was very laggy/jerky. It was very frustrating, even for mundane tasks like clicking the save button or closing out a program. I came to the reviews and saw one with the opposite problem (mouse works but not keyboard) and it mentioned line-of-site connectivity. So I took the dongle out of the hub (connected on left side of laptop where the only USB-C port is located) and put it on the right side (where my mouse resides)... Lo and behold! It works, but now the whole purpose for getting the hub is defeated.

title: EXCELLENT KBM setup!  Get it!

text: Well it's Logitech, so of course everything's exactly perfect.I've had this for over a year, and I think i've replaced the batteries once(?)Obviously the mouse is responsive & precise.Obviously the keyboard is snappy, with well-spaced keys (all where i expect them to be), and - in general - just a joy for typing.So let me tell you about its LESS OBVIOUS feature.When i bought my Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard and Mouse Combo well over a year ago - it came with the keyboard cover shrouding the keyboard.I almost threw it out mistakenly thinking it was protection for when shipping.  WOW!  Was i glad i kept it!!  AMAZING!  It's sort of like a "keyboard condom" in that it protects from the contamination of poor decisions!  :)Every so often i lift the cover to toss out all the crumbs that have collected.  And i have this totally pristine keyboard beneath.The cover NEVER interferes with my typing, indeed, i'm using it now as i type this review.  FANTASTIC!!If ever this keyboard wears out - i'm confident this is exactly the model I will purchase next. I love this KBM keyboard mouse combo!!!

The letter C on the C key is coming a bit off.One thing I really have to praise this keyboard, is the battery life. I've been using the same battery since the first day I began using it. product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Excellent set of features for a mouse and keyboard combo!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on November 27, 2020
text: I bought this combo after my previous one started to show some problems with the mouse (buttons failing and scroll not working at all). I had previous experience with the Logitech products, since my wife used an old combo (I think it's the MK190, but a version that isn't sold anymore). We had problems with this combo in the past, but Logitech replaced it with no stress at all, and it's still working after more than two years.So, the MK270 surprised me. It's not  the cheaper one, and it's not shabby. The material has much quality, and the keys touch is comfortable. The Logitech products are very power economic (so your batteries usually endure a lot), and I expect this one to be the same, since it has an auto shutdown function when you're not using it.The size is good, a little bigger than my old one because there is an additional row of function buttons (play/pause, volume, home, email, sleep and calculator). You can turn on and off both mouse and keyboard using a button. Mouse is comfortable, a little smaller than my previous one but the perfect size. The click is not so loud, and the scroll is pretty smooth. The sensitiveness is also pretty sharp. Overall the quality of  the product is high tier.Very good product, and since I'm using it everyday for leisure and work, it has been an enjoyable experience.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Plug n' Play. Quiet. Great tactile feedback
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on July 9, 2021
text: My current keyboard, an HP USB-connected board that came with a previous computer, was a bit noisier than I like. An OLD wireless Logitech mouse I was using started to have a mind of its own, even after cleaning. Time for something new.I chose the MK270 based on the brand and the $25 price. I opened the box, removed the battery tags for the keyboard and mouse, and plugged the dongle into my USB hub. When I turned on the keyboard, mouse, and Win10 laptop, everything worked without a hiccup!  Zero adjustments were required in the laptop's settings.The mouse is small, about an inch smaller than what I was using. I've found that I have fewer CTS issues with smaller mouses. The mouse is light and responsive, even without a mousepad.The keyboard has a soft clicking sound that gets louder if you hit keys harder. For those who do not type aggressively, the board is rather quiet. The keys feel spring-loaded for feedback, with a nice depth to the keys when typing. My laptop has almost no depth or feedback, which is why I use an external board. I'd definitely recommend this for purchase, whether connected to a laptop or desktop.

title: Very useful, but with occasional QC issues
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2020
text: Update: These are my go-to keyboard and mouse combos for general use with laptops & RPis. I have several of them. In general I can highly recommend them! However, one was received without a second tact switch below the LHS shift key, causing it to stick unless hit exactly correctly. I've updated my star rating from 2 to 4 because this was probably an isolated incident. Other keyboards of this model did not have this issue.Original review: In most respects this is an excellent keyboard, and I would give it five stars except for one glaring deficiencies. Left hand shift key should be equipped with two tact switches under it, because it is needs to respond to a press anywhere on its surface. However, it only responds to presses on the extreme left of the shift key. On removing the key to find out the reason for this problem, I found that the right hand side of the shift key was lacking a tactile switch, and thus It was doomed to failure if pressed on the right hand side. I am unsure whether this is a manufacturing defect, or a choice made by some numbskull MBA in the hopes of removing a couple of cents from the manufacturing cost of the keyboard. If it is the former, that speaks of poor QC. If it is the latter, then it may be a sign that this otherwise excellent brand is starting to slip downhill.

title: Seems to be a good keyboard / mouse combo
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on January 19, 2022
text: This is my second Logitech MK270 Keyboard / Mouse combination. I purchased my first set back in April of 2021 and it is now January 2022 and I've not replaced the batteries yet. I use the keyboard / mouse 5 days a week, 8 hours a day and probably realistically use this keyboard / mouse 70% of the time throughout the day. My job requires me to read through a lot of reports so there are times where I might go 30 minutes to an hour without toughing either device. I'm not for sure if the keyboard or mouse have a sleep mode but the battery life seems pretty good. I purchased the second one from the same provider and it seems to be working good so far. I also should mention that I usually leave the keyboard and mouse on through the week and physically turn them off on the weekend. I plan on leaving my new one on 24x7 to see how long it lasts before I have to change batteries.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Great keyboard!  Buy LOTS of spare batteries.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2021
text: (Note: I've only used the keyboard from the bundle.  Haven't tried the mouse.)Nice Features:- Keyboard is extremely light; it's no harder to lift than a TV remote.- Keys are comfortably spaced (at least for me.)  Other "light-weight" keyboards are often cramped.- It's a complete Windows keyboard.  No messing with an "Fn" key to use the numpad or function keys.- Key action is good for an office keyboard.  It lacks the responsiveness of a high-end mechanical keyboard, but most users should find it comfortable.- Batteries are easy to remove and replace.  It takes AAAs, so finding new ones isn't a problem.The only downside is battery life:- The keyboard gets about 24 hours of life out of one set of batteries.- There's no automatic power-saving feature, only a manual on/off switch.- There's now "low power" indicator.  When the batteries run low, the keyboard starts to drop key press/release events.  This is very bad for some games.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Cheap, for better and worse
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2022
text: This is a bargain for about $20-25. A wireless mouse and keyboard that work reliably and have good fit and finish. Yes, both feel kind of cheap and I wouldn't want to write a book using this keyboard. They work.Sadly, this model used to but no longer comes with or is compatible with the Unifying receiver. If you lose one of the three parts of the set, you'll have to buy a whole new set. Since it took work to redesign that feature OUT of this model, it's hard to see it as anything but deliberately gouging the consumer. Wooo, Logitech :|

text: I purchased this so I could use my laptop as a TV box for video streams, music playing, and basic gaming from a distance. Battery consumption is fantastic and exactly what I expect from logitech. Feel of components is at best good which is fine for the price though I wish it had a little bit more range... The mouse works fine when it comes to range to my knowledge but the keyboard can cut in and out from time to time. It's not like it becomes unusable but it does seem to struggle around maybe 8-10ft which can be a problem if you want to use it to turn use it comfortably from a couch when being the mod during movie night. It is a minor issue though I suggest being a little wary when using it in medium to large rooms... Also, don't buy this for hardcore gaming. There can be some minor delay from the keyboard.

text: I had an original Logitech mk270. Unfortunately, I dropped it and the clips broke so I bought this as a replacement. The new version is much lighter (both keyboard and mouse) made with cheaper materials. The keys feel a little harder to press but have a more tactile feedback. The mouse is slightly smaller than the previous versions. Overall, the package functions well. The logo is "logi" instead of "logitech" which I assume is because this is the international version. Overall, I guess for the price, you get a pretty good combo.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Works, Supplemented with a palm support
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on April 2, 2022
text: This works great. However I really miss having just a little bit of palm support. I had a small keyboard that this is replacing, but that one had just the tiniest palm support and it made a huge difference. In any case I bought one of those padded palm supports to supplement this and so now it’s fine. Had I known though I would’ve gone with the next model up that says it has a palm support.  That seemed so much bigger but I guess this is just a tad too compact. The main thing though, is it needs to work with the mouse as a combo. it paired perfectly.  plugged it in and instantly I was able to use it with my docking station.  Does what it needs to do.  I agree with other reviewers that the mouse is surprisingly tiny.  But didn’t notice that as much as the missing palm support on the keyboard.  So in the end it felt overpriced for what it ended up being because I had to buy the palm support separately but it works.  So, good enough.  Would buy something else next time though.

title: Basically okay, but issues with lagging and dongle range
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on May 10, 2021
text: The combo is what I expected, a basic wireless keyboard/mouse that can fit on my somewhat narrow keyboard tray. Everything is working now, but it took a support chat and some experimenting to get here. Initially there were huge lags between keystrokes and the characters appearing onscreen, and sometimes they came in garbled. The mouse was tracking wildly, very hard to control. Support chat: change the batteries, try it with another computer, place the dongle in a different port. I'll cut to the chase. It shipped with crap batteries. Replacing them helped, but the lags and mouse swings persisted. I finally put the dongle in a USB port on front of the computer, so 18" away from the keyboard and mouse with nothing in between to block the signal. Working ok now, but some keys, like the function keys, the calculator key, must be held for a second or two before they work.  So, its okay, but rather disappointing. Not what I expect from Logitech.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Simple wireless, perfect for console keyboard use; mediocre for high intensity use.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on October 15, 2020
text: I use this for Casual typing needs. I prefer wireless connections over guaranteed accuracy, so I was fine with this. The keyboard needed a USB Extension to get the receiver closer to my monitors since the actual tower is super far from the monitor I use. Once I got the USB extender for the adapter, all the input lag and missed inputs fixed themselves and it is working as intended. Be cautious, if you value high fidelity for typing, this has a ~.05% chance of missing keystrokes unless the USB receiver is close. After 3ft it started to stutter on me. Additionally, when my PC was processing a lot of things, it seemed that the range of the USB with high fidelity input dropped, thus why I opted into shortening the range by extending the receiver closer to my monitors. I use 3 monitors, so likely a normal consumer will not need the extender, but besides that it’s perfect for my needs.Mine came with batteries, so that was a convenient plus. I’m likely to buy another one for my other video game console to facilitate chatting on MMOs. Would definitely recommend for anyone that wants to interact on video games by typing instead of using voice chats, the wireless advantage is awesome.

The product itself is really good - both, keyboard and mouse are very comfortable, work great. The price is right and the packaging is awesome (I love how they thoughtfully put the USB part into the flip on packaging so that people don't miss it. I would know to look for it inside the mouse, but not everyone can guess that - so, it's quite clever to put the USB part visibly into packaging itself - can't miss it). Batteries are also supplied - great deal. The product works great and can last and last if you don't abuse it like I tend to by dropping things... My husband has the same set, and I am very happy with my replacement set too. Highly recommended!

text: It asked about a review for gaming so lets get that straight right away.  These are not for gaming.  No part of these are good for gaming.  They're wireless, which usually means a slight input lag, the keys are big and clunky and the mouse lacks all features you would want in a gaming mouse.These are great for work, though!  They complement my surface pro nicely and the full size keyboard is great for when I'm doing dual screen work where I have more space to spread out.  Overall, I love the mouse but the keyboard keys sit a bit higher than I normally like and I wish they had that lower profile but that's probably more my issue of not reading the product as opposed to a downside to the keyboard.  I've had this for 3-4 months now and I haven't seen any wear nor have I had to change the stock batteries and I've accidentally left these on so they must have a decent sleep or low power feature when not in use.Recommended for those who like higher set keys on a keyboard!

title: Probably the only wireless keyboard/mouse combination that works
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on March 18, 2021
text: This is my second time purchasing this keyboard/mouse combination. I have gone through several wireless keyboards, they all eat batteries. The logitech keyboards are the only ones that don't.I have another review from the first time I bought this, not sure why this didn't come up again. What I mainly wanted to add is that I have seen a lot of folks who had trouble with the keyboard, and I wanted to address that. The keyboard and mouse are very sensitive where you put the USB dongle vs. the mouse and keyboard, and what port it is in (power?). I saw the same symptoms others wrote about, with the keys lagging my input, and was able to correct it by moving the USB dongle to another port.Normally this would mark the unit as a problem, but again, this is the only such wireless unit I have found that does not eat batteries, so in my mind it is worth it. I have another logitech combo, a K330, that has a range extender on it. I use it on my living room home theatre system.

text: This goes to Logitech if they can be bothered with the reviews.Bought wireless set (keyboard and mouse) from them on Black Friday. Unwrapping... (suspenseful music plays ;) and here comes disappointment: the keyboard missing rubber pegs at the ends of flip legs. Which makes no sense - those legs take the pressure while typing and they shall be grabbing the desk most. Instead the keyboard elegantly sliding forward all the time. Closer check: there are even technological dents for the rubber pegs at the very tips, but no rubber. At the same spot we can see quality control sticker, which says "OK". Really?! Shame on you, Logitech! Returned, ordered exchange - same thing goes again - rubber pegs are missing. That makes no sense!Otherwise, good (could be good!) cheap keyboard. The transmitter could be that of Unifying series, unfortunately there is no red star, so you cannot use it with the Logitech products. Also, if you loose it - you have have to throw away the whole HID (Human Interface Device). Not too environmentally friendly!Logitech, please explain this!

title: Get it.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2020
text: This product has been a game changer for my 2020 WFH / grad school life.Set up could not have been easier (vs another product I bought and returned because it required downloading and pairing and a whole bunch of garbage I didn’t have the patience for) and I love the freedom it gives me if I want to move around but don’t want to mess with a ton of cords.My desk is cleaner. Switching between my work and school computer is super simple, and I’m just thrilled.The mouse also has great response. The mouse it replaced would give me constant issues with not tracking my movement, but this one is great!One of my favorite uses for it is sitting on my couch with my larger monitor set up on my coffee table. (Much easier on my back than the desk). You know how many cords that requires? Two!  One for power and one to connect to my laptop. No need to deal with tangling and setting up cords for my mouse and keyboard. It’s heaven.You may think I’m way too excited about this product, but it’s 2020. A wireless keyboard and mouse just might be an end of year highlight.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Comes with no instructions.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2020
text: This I my first wireless purchase - so I don't know anything about wireless. I knew you have to get the signal back and forth from the device to the computer. This unit requires a transponder to operate. I thoroughly searched the box to no avail. When I put the battery in the mouse I noticed a little black chip, in my ignorance I took to be part of the mouse,After hours of internet research I found a comment that the transponder is in the box but should be shipped tucked inside the mouse, after all, that's where you store it when moving stuff around. I opened the mouse again and removed the little unlabeled black thing again. Apparently someone figured that would be a good place for it when shipping.I noted a male plug, searched around the back of my computer for a slot for it, plugged it in and everything works great.MY POINT IS - If the manufacturers would include that tid-bit of information on a card in the box it would have saved me (and I'm sure other neophytes), I lot of frustration.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Good Keyboard, Horrible Mouse
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2020
text: The keyboard is quite nice, and the layout suits me well for every day office use.  The mouse, however, is horrible.  For starters, you have to download a separate program to control the mouse....except it only adjusts the mouse speed and lets you turn "smooth scrolling" off or on.  But a totally separate program install for a "combo" product.  And there is a "firmware update" for the set according to Logitech....but when downloaded there are no recognized products.  Crazy.The mouse's main problem is that it is ridiculously inaccurate.  As others have noted, trying to drag in a straight line is nearly impossible.  I'm not using this for gaming either, as some of the other reviewers have noted.  I'm talking about trying to use this mouse with Excel spreadsheets.  Dragging to highlight or copy/paste, etc. is very frustrating.  The mouse is always just a hair off, so I am consistently one row off for example, and trying to drag a little lower sends you past.  And it seems to double click Excel when switching windows, which minimizes it... a lot.Best advice, unless you want two dongles and do a separate keyboard and mouse, spend the few extra dollars and get a Microsoft or better combo.  This is truly "get what you pay for" with a nearly useless mouse (but again, the keyboard is great).  And before anyone points it out, the mouse is 18 inches from the dongle, so if there's interference I can't see how (and keyboard has no lag or issues at all, same dongle).

text: So I just started using this thing and I'm here to tell you it is cheap. Whoa! is this thing cheap!But it works... so far.Does it have super smooth keystrokes? No.Does it feel solidly built and sturdy? No.Does it have a reassuring but not overbearing weight? No, in fact, it feels like it might blow away if my one year old blows me a peanut-buttery kiss from over there. The mouse is something akin to the feeling of a large ping-pong ball.Is it ergonomic? In the most literal sense, yes. In the way, you are thinking, no. No, it is not.But it beats using the cramped and tiny keyboard on my laptop when I'm working from an undisclosed location hiding from the world outside.Update: I've been using this for a couple of days now and holy expletive the mouse is bad. Like, the keyboard is functional it's a little loud but the mouse! Oh my god, the mouse! The buttons barely work, the laser is out of sync or something because I'm constantly having to click things twice, the scroll wheel is indexed but somehow mushy at the same time. I have another Logitech mouse at the office that has and toggle for indexed vs non-indexed scrolling and both are better than this thing.Still five stars b/c you get what you pay for.

location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2021
text: I'm giving this 5 star review for one simple reason: this product actually works well. Compared to its competition, that's a big accomplishment.This keyboard / mouse set was the 4th one that I ordered off of Amazon. The others had those thin Apple-style buttons and they would, frustratingly often, just not fire. So I'd be typing and they would just miss a key I typed. So I'd have to go back and fix it and, as you can imagine, that got pretty old real quick. That's annoying when you're writing something. It's even worse when you're doing something like accounting that involves numbers being missed.This combo here has big clunky old style buttons and y'know what? They actually type the letters I want them to. For that reason alone, this product gets a full 5 stars. No connectivity issues. No "mouse disappearing from the screen" because it's a whopping 2.5 feet away from the receiver. It just works. Couldn't ask for more.

location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2020
text: I enjoy this full-sized keyboard which looks great on my desk.  It's made very well and I love that it has a volume control button right on top without having to use a function key  The mouse feels good in my hand, although it is one of the smaller sized Logitech mice and much lighter weight than the (Logitech) M705 which I also purchased on Amazon.  This Combination is great in that it uses the same USB for both the keyboard and the mouse. One of the best features is the plug it in and play and that it came with good batteries.  It was packaged nicely and delivered in a day.  I also like the numeric keyboard.  It's not a silent keyboard in that you do hear clicking when you type but it's not overly loud.  I also like the convenient on/off switch and the pre-programmed function keys.  This is an excellent set that I can use on my laptop or desktop.  It's cordless and has a nice range.  Very student-friendly and a great value for the price.

title: Basic but very useful

text: Really wanted the other Logitech ergonomic keyboard, but the price was twice what this one is - and it was huge.....  All I really need the wireless keyboard for is occasional production.  As mentioned by the other comments, the keyboard is a bit clacky/noisy, but also it was so inexpensive.  At least the keys are slightly cupped (which many no longer are).  The only reason I gave it a 4 instead of a 5 is that the dongle is not a "unifying" dongle... in other words, I cannot use my larger, preferred mouse (also Logitech) with the keyboard without taking another USB port.  All in all, for the very low cost,. for the compact size and for the level of use I have, a great alternative the much pricier, bulkier other Logitech wireless ergonomc options.

title: Replacement
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2019
text: This is a exact replacement for the incredible one I had for over 4+ years of 8+ hours everyday use (The mouse started becoming intermittent - the bottom of the the mouse looks like a ware zone - even though always used on a very smooth surface, must have been the Peanut Butter & Jelly sandwich dripping that did it in). Can be cleaned with a a lightly dampened cloth on keyboard or mouse. This is a full size standard keyboard), that takes a minimum of space). The battery's last about 3+ months even with everyday use and left on continuously. Great if you have a small desk or work place or need a full size portable keyboard for a laptop (Mouse and keyboard can be turned off/on if you are carrying around), a very small piece of Velcro will keep it  from moving if you are playing a game, not needed if normal use. The original required two wireless USB plug ins (keyboard & Mouse), the new one only require one. Looking forward to observe how long the new model lasts.> 3 Months - Mouse became intermittent-erratic after  (Failed to remember MSN Operating System Update before shutdown the night before)  - Changed Original Battery - Cleaned the Mouse internal Contacts (+/-) using pencil eraser (No Oxidization Visible), still erratic - Unplug/Re-plug USB with power on - device re-recognized by computer).  Mouse service restored.>5 Months = Unit disfunctional

The only cons i think is that the build quality is a bit cheap but, for a cheap mouse and keyboard combo set its understandable. Furthermore, I also don't like how the mouse and keyboard have two different battery types. The Keyboard uses AAA batteries while the Mouse is AA battery.  All in all, this keyboard is very good for its price i think it'll get the job done until i need a better one.

title: Convenient, works well
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2020
text: I hadn’t tried a wireless keyboard or mouse before purchasing this product, and I found it an excellent package deal to be able to purchase them both together.In order to use both the mouse and the keyboard, you insert a single, small dongle into a USB port on a laptop or PC. Both the mouse and the keyboard connect to that same dongle to allow you to use them wirelessly.Both the mouse and the keyboard work really well. I have not had any problems with either one of them.The one negative is the expense and hassle of putting a battery in both of them.A wireless mouse in particular is really convenient because I don't have to drag around a cable connected to it. Especially on my desktop, a mouse cable seems to constantly get caught on something.All in all, I am pleased with this purchase, and I would happily recommend this product to family and friends.

Both pieces should take the same size batteries.

text: My previous wireless keyboard-mouse combo was not working well - particularly the mouse so I decided to go with the name brand, Logitech for this replacement. Even came with batteries (nice touch).  The keyboard is a full keyboard so in additioon to various function keys, volume, play, home, etc. it has a full number pad to the right. text: I’ve had a combo keyboard and mouse for several years that I really liked, but the space bar was sticking and the mouse button had gotten stiff, so I knew it was time to replace them. I did not have to fiddle around downloading installation files or adjusting the setup. It was the easiest peripheral device installation I’ve ever experienced.  I like the small footprint of both devices, and they’re quiet.
