product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Marginal Quality at Best
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 28, 2019
text: Received the wireless keyboard and mouse today for use in my home office.  My findings are as follows:(1) Instructions in the packaging were minimal.  Normally that would not have mattered as it is just a wireless keyboard and wireless mouse, right?  Since there were no instruction I went online to troubleshoot when the keyboard would not work.  I was almost certain the disconnect was on my end!  There was some help through the manufacturer's website  but there was beginning to feel frustration because it wouldn't work!  After almost an hour with no connectivity on the keyboard, I changed out the new batteries that came in the box...magic it worked..(2)  The keyboard itself is light weight and kind of flimsy.  It is serviceable but I am not impressed with the quality.  Keys are not back lit but it is functions properly at this time,(3)  The wireless mouse is kind of a joke.  It is smaller than a standard mouse and is very flimsy, light weight and just feels cheap.  The first thing I noticed is that the spinner does not work smoothly.  I am almost certain that it is going to break BUT again it is serviceable today.  Note: Previously I was using anther full size Logitech mouse.  It appears that I will have to tie up a second USB port if I want to use that one.  Bottom line is that the keyboard and mouse are functional (thus the 3 stars) but they have the feel of something cheaply made.  I got what I paid for on this purchase.  I have not decided if I am going to return it or keep it.  I definitely would try a different model or spend a little more money on another option

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black

text: I bought 2 set of these at the same time. One for my work-from-home setup, and another for my personal desktop PC.  I use my work setup every day for hours and the keyboard/mouse work flawlessly, for this set.My personal setup, was a bit different. The mouse worked perfect, but the keyboard was intermittent. Every few minutes it would ac if not connected and then connect.  I swapped Keyboard combos between my WFH and personal setups and confirmed it was the keyboard. Amazon sent a replacement and received it the next day.So far the new keyboard seems to be working good after using it for a few hours.  I will keep an eye on it.  I would recommend this, as if it works as it should, it's a nice cheap cordless keyboard/mouse combo. If there's an issue, just be sure to get it replaced asap.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Not the best but just Okay
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2020
text: This is not the best made keyboard, even for the price. In fact, I was thinking Logitech was around for a while and could have done much better. It claims to have programmable keys, but it didn't come with software, so I assume I have to figure out on my own where to download it, or whatever they are programmed to do is all you really get by way of choices. Which isn't really "programmable" by definition. Just the standard home button, email button, and calculator button. Also a PC power button which I assume controls the power options in the start menu but so far doesn't work with my computer (Windows 10).My two biggest gripes are:1] The height adjusters on bottom of the keyboard don't seem to raise or tilt it forward very much at all compared to other keyboards. It's seems to be about 3/8 of an inch lower. So not very ergonomic.2] There is no light to indicate when Num Lock or Scroll Lock is on. How much money could they have possibly saved in production to need to leave that out? I use my Num Lock key all the time, so it is pretty annoying when I can't see what state it is in by just looking at the keyboard. Same with Scroll Lock which I use to turn off my X-Mouse Button Control app. So when my girlfriend is not looking, I am going to switching this one for her Jelly Comb keyboard. She's not going to care about these deficiencies, but I do.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Mediocre. Not Unifying Compatible.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 22, 2023
text: Honestly it's just OK. I should have read more into it, but the pair aren't compatible with unifying technology. I wanted to purchase the K270, but at the time, saw that the MK270 (Mouse and Keyboard combo) cost the same. Decided I might as well get a backup mouse essentially for free. Low and behold... that model (K270) has a unifying receiver and is compatible with existing unifying receivers, this junk does not... even though it's the exact same design, same model (almost I guess, there's an "M").Logitech, I like your stuff, relatively good quality, but what is this? I wouldn not have purchased this combo have I known it's INCOMPATIBLE with the unifying receiver. I'm not even asking for one (unifying receiver) as I have a few lying around, but you made it intentionally incompatible.I would have returned this instantly had I known. Now that I have opened it, I guess I'll just suck it up (23 bucks for an OK keyboard and a joke of a mouse). If you are purchasing this because it's Logitech and you think it is compatible with the unifying receiver, I rate this a 1/5. Ignoring the brand and simply judging it as an independent item, not expecting the unifying receiver to work... 3/5. Not bad, but there is better and cheaper stuff out there.

title: Pretty good kb/mouse, great low price
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2020
text: It's a good cheap w/l kb/mouse set.  I'm not dissatisfied.  Pros: very light, only uses two AAA batteries, front-mounted recessed on/off switch, CAPSLOCK LED.  Cons: PC sleep key in middle of media control keys (easy to mistakenly hit when using in lap), CAPS LED is the only LED (NUMLOCK LED would be nice, though I realize battery life was a consideration), and for some reason kb stops working at odd times and only starts working again when the kb is sharply jarred against the surface it is sitting on (ie picked up an inch and dropped).  It seems to be a dropping of connection, not kb sleep mode, as there is a buffer dump of previous key presses as soon as responsiveness resumes.  Kb is 10' from the USB receiver, but with unobstructed LOS. Though I have experienced this several times, it is still a rare phenomenon and I haven't ruled out environmental influences yet, so I am hesitant to declare the kb is at fault.  If I figure it out, I will try to update.

title: The mouse is aggravating

text: The keyboard is fine.  I got it because it has all the features I like: scroll lock, pause/break, print screen, lit caps lock, separate number pad and so on; also has soft keys which I like.  But the mouse!  It's smaller then I like (I have small hands and it's small), and it is so sensitive.  I'm constantly left or right clicking when I don't want to because I'm trying to rest a finger, but the second you drop your finger--it clicks with the slightest touch.  It's absolutely maddening. So I end up having to keep my finger hovering which is causing fatigue and frankly sore fingers at the end of the day. That has to be fixed--so I give it 1 star for ergonomics.

text: I've worn the letters off several of these and that means I like them.  My work gave me a fancy Lenovo wireless keyboard and I just didn't like the feel and layout of it so I asked for another Logitech.  I use Linux systems, Windows Systems, and Mac systems and it works with them all.  The keyboard isn't too big so it's easy to use on your lap or to set aside. If you're crunching numbers, the dedicated number pad and the calculator key are really handy.  And the mouse is great as well.  I really like this keyboard/mouse setup paired with a Thinkpad t430 or my newer t470.  I've used keyboards that were 100$ more expensive and always come back to this one.

title: All in all, a very excellent package at a very affordable price.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2021
text: Having purchased a HP Z240 high end computer, three Samsung 22" Business monitors and (made my own) purpose built raised base for the monitors to get some of my desk space back), the Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard and Mouse Combo was the final enhancement to the system "forced" on me by my son's generous gift of Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020.  All this because my old system would not run on the new software package!My new Logitech Keyboard and Mouse both work as intended.  The compact footprint of the full-size keyboard is great and much in keeping with my desire to keep an uncluttered desk.  The tactile feel of the keys is excellent and the extra row of programmed keys along the top edge is a very welcome bonus.  The accompanying mouse works well, but I may return to my previous mouse, just because of familiarity.All in all, a very excellent package at a very affordable price.

title: Not what I'm used to. Horrible feel TO ME
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on July 2, 2022
text: I have had Logitech combos for years, mostly the MK520s. On one of my sets the mouse started going crazy so after 5 years i figured it was time for a new set. I purchased this set even though is was a bit smaller (not as deep) and a little cheaper. Boy was that a mistake. Don't get me wrong, I really like most Logitech products. The first thing I noticed was the caps lock doesn't light up, which is annoying when my cat walks on my keyboard and then I need to put in my password. I could probably live with that but the keys protrude more than I'm used to and seem to be higher and less rounded/smooth so I'm constantly hitting Control or Windows key as I type I also constantly hit F11/12 when I backspace. The mouse seems to be a bit smaller, maybe it's just a small difference in shape but it doesn't feel right, When I move the cursor it seems to (skip or hesitate). The scrolling wheel tends to jump back up a few lines when scrolling down. This is not what I expected. I will keep it as a back up but invest in an MK0520 or MK540. It may be more expensive but well worth it.

title: Eh
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on September 1, 2020
text: **UPDATE** A couple of weeks later, I have already returned this product and knocked a star off of my review. Even with the USB receiver within sight of the mouse & keyboard, there was so much lag that I just couldn't work with it. I replaced it with a wired mouse and keyboard.**ORIGINAL REVIEW** This combo was working fantastically when I set it up, right up until today when I got a couple of hours into work and the keyboard basically stopped working. I turned both mouse and keyboard off, replaced the batteries, and disconnected then reconnected the USB receiver. Still having the same problem. The mouse works wonderfully but the keyboard is non-responsive.I started searching Amazon for another product, wanting to stick with Logitech but thinking maybe I should just get something at a higher price point. In a review of a similar Logitech product, someone explained that they had the same issue but corrected it by placing the USB receiver within sight of the keyboard and mouse. So, I tried this and it has seemed to fix the issue. (I have my monitors on my desk with the keyboard & mouse, but everything is run through my laptop which I had stored under the desk. I moved the laptop to the top of my desk.)It's all working fine now, but I'm still only giving three stars because this is not ideal. I'll continue to use this for now, but will be replacing it in the near future so I can have my desk arranged the way I prefer it to be. Prospective buyers.. be aware that you will likely need your equipment arranged in a way that allows the USB receiver to be within sight of the mouse and keyboard (so if you have a computer tower that's stored under your desk and would be difficult to place elsewhere, you'll probably want to go with something different)

title: Poor Quality.  Can't Recommend the Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard and Mouse Combo
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2022
text: I used to trust the Logitech brand, but we've now had 3 of these Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard and Mouse Combos, and they all have issues.  The first pair were difficult to wake up when we wanted to use them, and had poor connectivity.  So, I bought the second pair, which also had connectivity issues until I got a USB extender cable to have the dongle closer to my office chair, after I had already tried moving the dongle around on the front and back of the computer's USB plugs.  Then, I bought a third set for my wife, and neither the keyboard, nor the mouse want to connect.  So, Logitech's statement that these are plug-and-play, and that they reach 33 ft. away is not true; we can't even get them to reliably connect 5 ft. away, with direct line-of-sight.  Therefore, I cannot recommend the Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard and Mouse Combo because they are poor quality.

title: Thank you Amazon Customer Service Rep.  Saved me from returning an item for no reason.

text: The USB Dongle is tucked inside of the battery compartment where it is hard to see and I thought it was missing. What they should do is color the top of the dongle differently so it stands out for those with less than perfect vision like myself.  I am extremely technically proficient but I missed this little crucial part.  I forgot the Rep's name who helped me and resolved it in about 20 seconds on the phone but I appreciate competent customer service rep's like the fellow who helped me just now.  Thanks.  Otherwise you can't go wrong with Logitech keyboards and mice.  I have been using them for years for custom builds and wherever a wireless device can be used.  Sometimes in the business place you want your mice and keyboards to be wired so employee's don't loose them and render a work station useless. product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Decent basic keyboard - a couple of items to keep in mind
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2020
text: This keyboard works as advertised.  Here are some issues you may want to consider before buying.  There are no caps lock or num lock lights.  The little bumps on the F and J keys are almost non-existent.  There's a bit of something there, but not what I'm used to when feeling for those keys to keep my fingers on the home-row.  Also - this keyboard and mouse DO NOT use the Logitech Unifying Receiver or software.  The receiver that comes with the product does not have the Unifying logo (first clue) and the keyboard and mouse do not work with a Unifying receiver (if you have one).  If you think that is the case, and use the Unifying software to try to pair the devices to the receiver - you will have no luck.  You will need to find and install a different app from Logitech to pair the devices.  Windows 10 on one of my computers did find the receiver and install the software automatically - without the need of the special Logitech software.**Update**  I was wrong about the Caps Lock light - there is one.  There is not a Num Lock light however.  No Num Nuts light either (or I may have been warned about my Caps Lock light observation when posting my initial review).

title: no num lock light; f & j finger guides hard to feel/find and full size keyboard but not the mouse
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2021
text: No num (number) lock light; f & j finger guides hard to feel/find and full size keyboard but not the mouse.This a nice keyboard but needs to have a num lock light.  If you are buying a full size keyboard with ten key pad that is because you are going to use the ten key pad.  So make easy to see if it is activated; better yet make the ten key function the default with the light showing it is off.Many are working at home and do not need to illuminate the area we just need better f & j finger guides. We do not need to look down at a black keyboard to get back on track just easy to feel finger guides.Also this mouse is too narrow make it full/adult size.  Regular size keyboard regular size mouse. Right.I would be great make an wireless chargeable illuminated/backlit keyboard mouse combo for non gamers, no crazy multi arcade style colors; something for business/accountant class consumer that might have the occasional client visit.  Do not forget about making a comfortable ergonomic design for a reasonable price.  Note over $50 is too much.

title: Quality keyboard I've now bought for the 3rd time

text: This is a quality keyboard for the price, and I'm glad they keep making it, so that's why I bought my third one.I sit at my computer all day doing work. I'm not a full time typer, but I type a fair bit during the day. I like the size and feel of this keyboard. I've never liked the ones with a palm rest, and could never get used to the ergonomic ones either.I don't use the mouse because it is too small for me, so that goes into the drawer as a spare. (my preferred mouse is the Performance MX).One of my favorite features are the quick buttons at the top. I use the calculator a lot so having a button there is darn handy. Plus having a mute button or volume up/down is great too.My only beef (and this is a small beef) is that after a couple years of use every day a few of the letters wear off and the space bar has two shiny spots where my thumbs hit them all the time. If you were a full time typist, it probably would do this after a few months.Other than that, I love it!

Other than that, it works great, never saw a keyboard and mouse run off a single usb, but that saves me a slot I guess. product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Problems with transmitter USB3 ports after recent windows update.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 9, 2021
text: Immediately after a recent required Win10 update was pushed out, my previous Logitech wireless keyboard became highly unresponsive and laggy with drastically reduced range. Thinking it was a battery issue, I put in fresh ones, yet the behavior continued.Figuring it was an issue with the radio in the keyboard, I purchased this one, only to have the exact same problems.After hours of troubleshooting/reinstalling drivers/updating firmware, I finally figured out what it was. Something about the latest Windows USB drivers does not play nicely with the Logitech transmitters when plugged into any USB3.0 port on my PC. Changing the receiver to a USB2 port solved the problem immediately!I have been a big fan of Logitech wireless keyboards for a long time, so this was a relief, and I can't really blame Logitech for this issue, but I am bumping down what would otherwise be a 4 or 5 star rating to a 3, because even if this issue does not affect all configurations, I am sure there are others out there who will be unpleasantly surprised by it, and they may not have extra legacy USB2 ports they can rely on to get around it.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black

title: USB port for the Receiver? Windows 10 build 1909
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on April 11, 2020
text: Short Story: Use USB 2.  Long Story:I did a quick set up of the keyboard and mouse. I just plugged the RF receiver into the first available USB port and went about my business. I noticed some mouse tracking issues and minor keyboard lag but didn't think about it too much. Until I went into a game though.  The latency was bad. I'd press a game key and nothing would happen. The mouse put me behind or in the wrong place. Did some basic research that didn't amount to anything but one random page suggested issues with the receiver plugged into USB 3.  Easy enough. I used an open USB 2 port and all issues went away immediately.  In game and out.  USB 3 ports are easy to spot: If it's in a dark spot shine a light on it and look for the blue tab.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Great bargain, good quality from a solid brand
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on March 18, 2020
text: Got this Wireless Keyboard+Mouse combo mostly for my Raspberry Pi’s. While I have used wireless keyboards and mice before, I havent personally owned any, because as a gamer, the technology had never been as dependable as a hardwired keyboard and mouse. While that tech now exists, my gaming days are behind me and as I said, I needed this mostly for my new ‘game’ aka my Raspberry Pi’s. I do wish that the whole Unifying receiver technology caught on and was more prominent in wireless devices, but for my use case, this setup has been perfect. It makes life much easier to not have to unplug my keyboard and mouse from my desktop PC to use in my Raspberry Pi 4 or PiZeroW. For the price of $20 for the combo, coming from a very well known company in the peripheral space, this combo is really hard to beat. I highly recommend this to anyone who would be using this combo for normal daily use that doesnt require a mechanical keyboard or gaming mouse.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Updated but NOT Better
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on January 29, 2019
text: Logitech in their infinite wisdom has dropped the unifying dongle from this product. Instead you get a single dongle that only works for this keyboard and mouse. Even worse, they have replaced the Set-Point software with something new called "Options". This download is 3 times the size of the old Set-Point software, and the first thing it does is ask you to create an account and to share your history! No Thank You!  Of course the "Options" software only controls the mouse, so if you want to map the keyboard, you still need to install the Set-Point package!  I uninstalled the "Options" package since this mouse is a very basic mouse and can be controlled with Microsoft generic options. The only function that you lose is the battery monitor.While I have always been a fan of Logitech products, this change from the unifying dongle and this keyboard in particular are changing my opinion. The keyboard has a pretty solid feel to it, but it constantly drops keystrokes. Since that is the primary function of a keyboard, I cannot recommend it. Also, the mouse that comes with this package feels really cheap (probably because it is cheap).  Those 2 problems combined make this package not a bargain. I am very disappointed that Logitech is dropping the unifying dongle and software. That change alone is enough to make me look elsewhere for keyboard and mouse replacements. Overall, not recommended!

text: This is my third MK270 combo.  The new one has the lowercase "l" in "Logitech"Likes* Mouse more accurate than some of Logitech's full size mice* Keyboard has right-side context menu key (essential for MS Excel), not the Fn key found on newer Logitech models* PC Power button just above the F8 key great for putting a closed laptop to sleep* Great price for the pair when on saleDislikes* Where is the orange and green coloring for on and off like on the previous version? Bad move* logi Logo on nano receiver is hard to see: is the receiver upside down?* Wish the mouse was full size and had a better "click" - new keyboard seems a bit mushy, hopefully it will break in* Not unifying compatible as far as I can tell (even if you get the separate unifying receiver)* Keyboard battery compartment hard to open; you need a coin or a butter knife to open itOverall can't go wrong for the price.  One star taken away for the cheap new on/off swtiches

title: Mouse could be a little bigger, sharp edges, worth what it costs
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on October 8, 2018
text: For larger hands, this smaller-sized mouse could be a little less comfortable. You can't rest your palm on the mouse - you have to grasp it with your fingers.  I suspect I'll get used to it.  They keyboard is nice, requires a slightly firm touch, but fast enough.  Speed typers may need to slow a bit.  The border of the one that I received has a slightly sharp edge to it - perhaps that would wear over time - but it feels like it has the potential to cut something.  That might sound trivial, but put it in your backpack and it might wear the material sooner than it should.  I do like the power buttons on both the keyboard and mouse, and these units work both the mouse and keyboard from one USB dongle.  The dongle stores in the mouse.  If you have several dongles from other products, take the time now to somehow mark this one's source (e.g. paper under tape) so you'll always know what dongle goes with which device.  Worth at least as much as it costs.

text: Not a super fancy setup, but this bluetooth keyboard and mouse work well.  I have one set for the office and one for home (I work from home 90% of the time).  Both the keyboard and mouse connected via bluetooth w/o the need for any drivers.  When I first connected, there was a significant delay in keystrokes and mouse movements, but after about 15 mins there were no issues.  I've been using these for about 4 months now and no major complaints.  The keys are sturdy, responsive, and I can type quickly without skipped keystrokes.  The mouse is very responsive - if it's too speedy you can adjust in your computer's mouse settings.  My only complaint is that the mouse doesn't have back/forward buttons and for some reason I keep accidentally right-clicking, but that's just me.

text: I already had one of these and am using it on my desktop with a dual computer setup. The original one has been functioning flawlessly for years, with very few batteries ever used despite rarely being turned of.  So far, this newer item performs just as well. text: Pros:Keyboard feels decent to type on.Takes normal person AAA / AA batteries instead of those newfangled built-in lion batteries.Battery life seems longCons:Mouse is too tiny for my giant monster handsRarely the keyboard will turn itself off if I haven't typed on it for a bit, then take a few seconds to get going again.Want to configure windows to exit sleep mode with keyboard but not mouse? Talk about a flagrant disregard for useless button tradition!One very important step is to disable Window's USB power saving features. text: I didn't set my expectations high when I purchased this keyboard and mouse combo. One thing I could say is that yes, it is affordable but, you actually get what you pay for. Everything pretty much works like it should but the mouse design leaves a bit to be desired as it is easy to accidentally tilt the mouse as you're using it, causing the optical sensor on the bottom to pull away from the mouse pad causing erratic control.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Compact and light, mouse is small
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2019
text: I bought this keyboard and mouse for travel purposes.  The mouse is small and for my big hand that is a problem IF I was attempting to use it all the time.  The mouse is also very light weight even being its that small.  I might try it attach a tungsten weight at some point.The keyboard is a typical Logitech K-serious feel to it.  It is light and I wouldn't get to crazy with how you handle it.  If you travel with the keyboard (I sometimes do) use wisdom on how you pack it.  Overall, the keys are typical responsiveness I expect from a logitech keyboard.  I use a mechanical (another company) at home on my desktop/gaming machine, and at work I use a K-series wired board with mouse combination.  I like the feel well enough that I can switch between the two types easily.The wireless connectivity of the system was fast and easy to get to work on my Windows 10 machine.  No problems so far.  I didn't have to pull anything fancy either.

There are fingerprints on the keyboard and mouse.If I hadn't needed this urgently today, I would have returned this. Really disappointed in the handling practices.  I expect more from Amazon.

text: After reading some of the good reviews of this product, I was surprised at the poor design quality and the small size of the mouse. The design of the shift key makes it hard to avoid hitting it, which means the CAP LOCK keeps engaging. It's very annoying. The keys have a "weird" feel to them. After using it a week, I never got used to it. Also, the mouse is travel size--very small and uncomfortable. I'm returning it and going back to the 8 year old set, which is much better quality. Also, the product was shipped in the flimsy box the product comes in--no outside packaging. When it arrived, it looked like someone had run over it with a truck. Luckily, the product itself was intact.

title: Sweet Spot
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on June 26, 2020
text: Not top or bottom of the line - just solidly in the middle. That made it perfect as a keyboard/mouse combo to use with my laptop. Key feel is good (a little light for my preference but acceptable. Keyboard is not bouncy like some are. It sits solidly in place, with or without the fold out legs. The mouse isn't the most comfortable I've used, and the design placing the scroll wheel so close to the front edge means my fingers are often feeling the gap between the split pressure keys and the body of the mouse. It's an odd feeling or the gap between the pressure keys themselves. Disconcerting, but that could just be because I'm a pianist and my fingertips are particularly sensitive. That's hardly a deal killer. This is a solid wireless keyboard/mouse set for a good price.

It will definitely drain batteries faster no matter how good they might be.  2. Games especially FPS games require a dedicated gaming mouse with zero input lag. This mouse and keyboard is for work purposes only.

title: Dead Batteries
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on November 30, 2021
text: Unpacked them, excited to finally have my desktop all set up and be able to get to work. Was happy to see that they came with batteries, since I don't have any! I plug in the USB and get no response from the devices. I check them and realize there is an on/off switch "duh, of course," I think to myself and then I realized. Oh. They were swapped to "on". The batteries are dead. Interesting to ship something with the batteries and leave the device on so they are completely drained when they get to the customer.Since I can't actually use then at the moment I can't give much if a review. However, the mouse and keyboard do look nice and the keys don't stick and aren't super loud. I'll post an updated review once I convince my roommate to buy me batteries.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Technical support is a waste of time. Not a happy customer!!!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on November 11, 2022
text: Had combo a hair over a month now and all of a sudden my mouse/cursor goes all over the screen when trying to select a certain area. Tried changing speed and replaced battery yet neither fixed the problem. Decided to contact Logitech technical support, explained it was the mouse multiple times and even gave them the serial number yet each time they responded, they were talking about the keyboard. How's fixing the keyboard, when nothing is wrong, gonna fix the mouse? So after roughly 5x's of this I was pretty perturbed and sent them a not so nice email capitalizing the word mouse each time hoping to get through their thick heads. Still waiting for a response so I can tell you this is the last Logitech product I buy no matter what the reviews say.... I tried contacting them at least 2 more times and each time was ignored so now I'm stuck with a wireless mouse that doesn't work correctly. Now, being on a limited budget, have to either replace the mouse or get another combo (which I'd prefer) and I can definitely say due to product support, I'll NEVER buy a Logitech product again no matter how good the reviews.

I am satisfied with this product and I recommend it.

location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2022
text: This keyboard/mouse combination has always been my favorite. I order 5 or 10 at a time. The latest batch I received has a fatal flaw in my opinion. I don't know if it has always been this way, but the space bar is difficult to press. The button under the spacebar that actually registers when it has been pressed is at the left end of the space bar. I always press the spacebar with my right thumb. This arrangement and perhaps because the space bar itself twists some makes it hard to press the space bar. Sometimes it doesn't register at all and I have to backup and add the missing space.

text: This is a good reliable product. I have one at work and one at home for the last 4 years. On one, the letters are just beginning to wear off. Batteries last a long time.Bottom line: great product, but rotate them out in about 3-4 years.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: This is a great keyboard and came with batteries
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2020
text: I have no complaints about this keyboard/mouse combo. The price was right and the keyboard is a perfect size. The keys feel substantial and are much easier to type on than a Mac keyboard. I notice other reviews have knocked ratings down due to lagging and because the nanoreceiver is not compatible with other logitech products. On the first point, I have noticed absolutely no lagging at all. On the second point, it's true that the nanoreceiver only works for the keyboard/mouse combo, but that is not a problem for me at all. Knowing that when you buy it, I see no reason to deduct a star for that. You can pay more for a device that has that feature if it's important, but I find this device perfectly sufficient for my needs.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Disappointing
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 1, 2021
text: Plug and play worked. Keyboard feels like a $15-20 keyboard, about as expected. Mouse feels like a $5 toy, not as hoped for, but for the price as a bundle not too far out of line.But build quality and feel don't matter because neither works as expected.Tried in multiple ports and at multiple angles and ranges. Both only work intermittently - you have to wiggle the mouse many times to get the cursor to go where you want, and the keys only work about 50% of the presses, especially if you leave the keyboard untouched for a few minutes, like it has a sleep powersave and then has trouble reconnecting to the dongle.I assumed this was just because of the distance, because I was originally trying about 20 feet apart, and there were no obstructions, even had the PC case oriented so it was direct line of sight from the dongle to the kb/mouse and new batteries had no effect.But moving it to 5-6 feet made no difference - I still can't use the keyboard without multiple presses for each keystroke, and mouse glitches out periodically as if it's a bad signal.For office use, it's frustrating and a productivity killer.For any gaming needing faster more accurate inputs than something like chess, it's unusable.Compared to an Apple wireless kb/mouse pair on another system in the same room, it's night and day. Of course those cost 10x as much, but no matter how cheap a thing is, it should still do what it's built and advertised to do. Maybe it won't feel or look as nice, or do it as well, or last as long as the premium versions, but it should have a minimal level of usefulness.This keyboard doesn't type reliably.This mouse doesn't move the cursor reliably.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Most frustrating customer service experience
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2022
text: This product was working great for two days. That’s about it. I called Logitech for tech support and it was the least helpful experience. It first asks you for your order number, but my Amazon one was not accepted. They then transferred me over to someone who gave me support ticket. I was then transferred over to another person who I read back the ticket number they just gave me. This will happen everytime you call because you can’t just give them your ticket number. After the call and some emails, they sent me a new receiver. I followed all the directions that came with it as well as other instructions I found online and on their website. Still did not work. Reached out again to the Logitech and turns out they gave me the wrong receiver. This is not a new issue since I just read a comment saying that you need a specific receiver and this particular one does not work. Sending mine back and I’m looking forward to not having to deal with Logitech ever again.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: slippery keys, small lightweight mouse
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2021
text: Everyone has their own feel that they like.  I found these keys to be "slippery."  I prefer raised keys so I can feel the edge of main keys, but these keys are not raised high enough.  The most annoying feature was the F-keys are right above the main keys and felt "crowded."The mouse was disappointing.  I have another full size Logitech mouse which is heavy and my favorite. This one is smaller and very lightweight.  And the default mouse configuration in Windows did not allow me to adjust the sensitivity.  It either crawls across the screen or it flies!  No in between.One note:  the dongle (receiver) is indeed located in one of the box flaps.  I knew about it, and I still had to search the box to notice it.  Logitech should mark it much better.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Cost effective functional keyboard and mouse
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2020
text: I took a single star off.  The unifying software downloaded from logic tech doesn't recognize the dongle as being unifying.  The dongle itself  does not have the unifying logo on it.  The package does not state unifying.  The comparison chart refers to all the dongles as "unifying" apparently this is not accurate.  For most people, this is not a negative -- and the device is fully functional.  It just can't be programmed to work with additional unifying logitech devices -- and would require using an additional usb port.

I have adjusted it frequently with my cave man club, hence the need for a new keyboard and rat.I am very pleased.

title: Not what you'd expect from Logitech
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2022
text: I returned this product after using it for two weeks. The keyboard and mouse connection would cut in and out causing lag issues with typing. Also, I had to hold the mouse in a very uncomfortable way in order for the cursor to move. I almost had to press down on the entire mouse in order for it to read that I was moving it. The right click on the mouse was VERY sensitive. Just resting your finger on it makes it click. This caused me so many frustrations. The main issue I had with this product was the mouse, but the keyboard isn't exactly the greatest either.I did not like that there is a power button for your PC on the keyboard itself. I found myself accidentally hitting it when picking up the keyboard which turned my computer off. This is not something that is needed considering you can turn your computer off with the mouse (you know, how you would normally turn a computer off).Logitech products have really gone down hill. I was quite disappointed with this product. I do not recommend this product if you are a heavy user or for gaming.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Important -USB dongle is not in mouse. It is attached to packaging!!!!!!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2020
text: This was the first wireless keyboard I bought for myself, and should have read more reviews. ALMOST RETURNED this since keyboard and mouse were not being found after changing batteries. I was about to repack it, when I saw on the package that it is supposed to have a USB dongle included. I didn’t see one when unpacking - however I thought I’d check closer by shining a light in the box. The dongle was NOT inside the mouse, but housed snugly in one of the cardboard slits on the end of the box!!!!!!!! ??? I am talking the mouse was attached to the box on the inside. This was supposed to be frustration free packaging???What if I’d thrown the box out? Would never have seen it in there.  Once I attached the dongle, everything worked as promised, but my fault for going by price and not reading reviews thoroughly. It’s a little on the big side, as well, a little clunky, and the mouse is tiny by comparison.  As long as it works...

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Great keyboard, great price, actually has the caps lock led light indicator on the keyboard
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on July 31, 2020
text: These are much more ergonomic than the original wired keyboards that come with most pc computers. The keys are easier to press so our staff can type faster with less strain/effort. Key presses are not excessively noisy. We needed an efficiently priced keyboard, not overly bulky, ergonomic. We chose this specific Logitech keyboard for the Caps Lock indicator light - the software we use is caps sensitive, and we have to constantly log in/out and access different functionalities. A lot of newer keyboards now do not indicate anywhere on the keyboard whether or not you have caps lock on or off, so having this indicator helps to save a lot of wasted time and frustration for our work. In short, great keyboard, great price, fits all of our needs.

text: Works with os from windows 10, and down...something that should be mentioned in the product description...but, it's noted on the packaging. Keyboard came with the 2 triple a batteries, but you're going to need 2 AA's for the mouse. Both are equipped with their own on/off system to help reduce battery drain when not in use.

title: no dang dongle
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on November 30, 2020
text: Arrived without a dongle inside. Had no external packaging, just the manufacturers box (which is fine by me, but may be an issue to others). The box was sealed with plain clear tape, but the plastic bag with the mouse wasn't closed and the dongle wasn't inside the mouse where it's is supposed to be... or anywhere else for that matter.Luckily this was a purchase to reorder the same item I bought a year ago so I had a dongle to pair it to. Replacing that set because the left button on the mouse became finicky... sometimes registers double clicks when I did not click twice... other times when holding the left button to highlight it will behave as if i let the button go when I did not. I would buy a different brand but I had the same thing happen in about the same time frame with the last Microsoft mouse I owned. No issues with this keyboard and love how small and light it is.

Then, with any keyboard click the keys light up again.It's more expensive than most other boards but it's an example of "ya git whatcha pay for" ... I'd buy it again

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: A simple, cheap, comfortable, reliable wireless keyboard and mouse combo
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 2, 2019
text: A simple, cheap, comfortable, reliable wireless keyboard and mouse combo. Anyone looking for premium features like a backlit keyboard will be disappointed, but at this price, you shouldn't expect all that extra stuff, and many people are fine with just the basics. And that's what this combo is, very basic. The mouse can only point, click, and scroll, and besides a few shortcuts keys at the top, the keyboard is nothing special either, though i do appreciate the caps lock light and volume controls in particular.The mouse is smaller than most mice and it was a little strange at first, however i have gotten used to it and actually prefer the lightness and comfort of it now. However there is 2 small problems with the mouse to me. One is the slightly louder than normal click, and second is the lack of a back button on the side. Still, considering the price, i think this wireless mouse/keyboard combo is great, and i have purchased a second one for my second computer.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Mouse has way too much lag
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2019
text: I've had this product for almost two months now (key word, almost). The keyboard has mostly been fine. A few weeks ago it started to get glitchy but a simple change of the batteries fixed that. That in itself is a bit of an issue. I don't use this keyboard 24 hours a day seven days a week. Merely just a few hours 3-4 days a week. Is the battery life really just 5 weeks of minimal use? That's going to cause me to burn through batteries. Anyway, this a minor issue, the real issue here is the mouse.The mouse.It's terrible. The lag is constant. Constantly clicking somewhere and the mouse doesn't get there in time. Constantly trying to move the mouse somewhere and it just stops for a split second and clicks the wrong button (often closing tabs or messing up something you're working on). I don't like wireless mice because no matter how many people say "oh I don't have that problem with this one," there's always lag and this one is no different.I've tried everything. I've googled why my mouse is lagging all over the place. I've made sure to close unneeded browsers. Made sure to close unneeded apps. Made sure to keep other USB unplugged when I don't need them. I've restarted my computer. NOTHING works. The mouse constantly lags (my computer is not old and when I use a wired mouse I have zero problems). This mouse works for about five minutes a day and after that it just drives me insane.I'd highly recommend buying a wired mouse, but if you're dead set on wireless, buy a different one.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: It's cheap and works with Windows, but that's about it.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2020
text: I bought this because my laptop keyboard began to fail.Pros- Inexpensive - I paid $19, including tax- Both the keyboard and mouse work with Windows with no problems - so far.- Batteries were included - 1 AA for the mouse and 2 AAA for the keyboard.- Includes all standard/function keys plus dedicated media buttons.  Shortcut keys for email, web home page, power and calculator.- All of the shortcut keys work with no config - except the email key - see cons below.On the con side:- There is no LED to indicate that the keyboard is on.  If there is supposed to be, the LED on my keyboard  doesn't work.- If you use Gmail or another online service, the email shortcut key may not be usable.  I use Gmail and when I pressed the email key, Windows Mail launched. If this can be configured to work with online email services, Logitech provides no instructions in the box.- Unifying receiver is incompatible with newer Logitech software and devices.- The mouse is bare bones - left and right click buttons and a scroll wheel with middle click function.  No next/back buttons, no tilt scroll wheel.  This mouse is best for emergencies or for temporary use until you get a new mouse with better features, etc.Bottom line - you get what you pay for.

title: After getting 2 sets, it still won't work
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2021
text: I ordered this for a new PC to be able to play/work from my couch without their being cords everywhere. I get it, plug the dongle in, and the keyboard flat out doesn't work. Change the batteries, still nothing. Mouse occasionally worked, but then would randomly freeze, making it terrible for gaming and essentially anything else.Ordered a replacement set to see if maybe if just gotten a faulty one. It happens. Nope. Keyboard does work this time, but once it goes to sleep it takes 5 seconds or so for it to start input, and it'll pick up from the last keystroke, meaning you'll  often have to rewrite sentences or words. Mouse is essentially the same as the last - works fine for a few minutes, then spazzes out and starts freezing for 5 or so seconds.Not sure if it's just a poor Bluetooth connection, but I doubt it as I have zero other problems with Bluetooth devices on the computer and the tower is directly in front of me at no more than 5 feet away. But it's impossible to recommend at all for any use. You'll die playing games because the mouse will just stop working midgame for no reason, leaving you as a easy target for enemies. You also can't use it for basic functions either for the same reasons.Logitech needs to take this trash product off of the market immediately. I had a very high opinion of their products before I bought this, and now I'm debating on ever buying from them again now.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Well built, inexpensive, syncs to WIN 10 flawlessly but Frustrating POOR (unique) product packaging
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2020
text: Nice keyboard and mouse for my backup business laptop.Took off 3 stars off for packaging.  First a gripe that Amazon ships a "cereal box cardboard"  thickness package  without a corrugated shipping box.  Product box arrived bent, crushed and battered, but the product was ok.The real reason to take 3 stars off is what could be a positive (minimal and efficient packaging) being a little to clever by half.  The USB receiver is packaged in an end slot tab - when you expect the product to be "in" the box and not part of the box. Clever but not clear.  Might work is is was indicated to open the end flap. Nothing on packaging to indicate that one flap is "special".  So 50/50 chance consumer will open wrong end, slide out the mouse and keyboard and NOT find the USB receiver.  I was about to contact Amazon that the USB was missing when I examined the other end and found the USB sticking out of a slot in the cardboard end.  Again, clever, nice use of minimal packaging. But really the engineers at Logitech should know this is a non-standard way of packaging and then CLEARLY indicate the end of the box to be opened.  There is NO indication on the outside of where the USB is lurking.  Poor decision.  Minus 3.

text: I purchased this set in May 2020. I use it 5 days a week at my job. I have yet to replace the batteries!! That is worth the purchase alone to me!! My Dell at home came with a wireless keyboard and mouse. I've replaced those batteries 5 times since July and we rarely even use it. Full disclaimer though - I turn it off every evening when I leave work. I thought that would get annoying, but now it's just part of my routine. Not an issue at all! Could not love this set more!!

text: Not sure if I got a bad one or that I should have known how it worked for the price. Quality-wise for materials it's fine for the price, it's cheap but doesn't feel like it will die right away. The keyboard doesn't seem to have the same problem. I will spend more next time that is on me.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Mouse is so LOUD!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2021
text: Let me say, I used this for one day and loved it so much I bought a second one for my house (first being for work). By end of day 2 or day 3 I noticed the mouse was soooo loud. I feel like I am a pest a distraction in the office with how loud it is. my coworker commented on how loud it is as well so I know I'm not crazy. I am returning because it drives me THAT batty. The keyboard is fine, I did notice a slight lag when it wakes up from sleep but all keyboards do that and the words do appear, just slightly slow. I'm someone that doesn't really look at what I'm typing on the screen or the keys so it didn't bother me. I do a lot of looking at people's faces and typing sort of work. If you stare at the screen while you type I still don't think it would bother you in the long term unless the lag gets more noticeable over time. But I'm not giving it longer than a week because the MOUSE IS SO LOUD.

The keyboard has a nice feel and the mouse is very responsive.IMO this set is a good buy and a quality product.

text: I needed a cheap wireless keyboard and mouse and this fit the bill perfectly. Small like I wanted but with the same great Logitech keyboard feel. I do like the215 mouse better as it's a bit bigger and fits my hand better, but for the purpose, this one is great. Plugged it in and it worked right off the bat with Windows 10. Third wireless keyboard and mouse on my desk and no interference between any of them.One slight issue, but I don't think it's the mouse. I plugged a San Disk 256gb stick in next to the receiver and the receiver got real jumpy on the mouse and the keyboard quit working totally. Used another USB stick drive and didn't have a problem. But if you hit that situation, be advised. Moved receiver to the back of the PC and problem solved.

text: The mouse seems fine, but the keyboard keeps losing connection.  It also lags slightly which is incredibly irritating.  I've purchased cheap $10 wireless keyboards on Amazon that worked 1000x better than this keyboard.  It doesn't have a lighted indicator for number lock or a battery indicator.  Only one for caps lock.  I also don't understand the need or placement of the power button for the PC on the keyboard.  Always bumping it while typing, and causing a shutdown sequence.  Worthless as a keyboard, and also makes a lousy paperweight.  I'd give it away, but I don't want to inflict it on anyone.

As I closed up the box and went to insert the flaps that folds over on the box - boom - there was the USB tucked in a little slot.  That's the last place I thought it would be!!  (see pictures)I am using the keyboard as I type this review - I love it!!  Mouse fits nicely in the grip of your hand as well.  Now I am happy - found the USB and can start using it right away! title: Quality Product

text: This product is small, but not too small. It's compact. The is my SECOND unit. I wore the letters off my Microsoft keyboard and it was larger and more expensive. But the letters should not have - literally -  rubbed off the keys over time. The older copy of this keyboard looks exactly like the new one and is going strong with no signs of wear.The Microsoft USB transceiver module stores programming from Windows - even after shutdown. This can interfere with other Operating Systems - like Linux. Logitech doesn't have that problem.

title: Great keyboard, mouse not so much
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on March 25, 2020
text: The keyboard is pretty good - nothing fancy but does everything I need.  It has shortcut buttons to launch web browser, email, calculator, and power/shutdown options.  Also has audio controls.  It's got the feet so you can put it at an angle if you like (but you don't have to). The mouse, on the other hand is beyond basic.  It's what you would find in a bargain bin.  It's got a really loud click to it - people on the other end of conference calls can hear me clicking around.  Also, size-wise, it's really small.  So if you've got bigger hands, it's not a great fit. I'm a woman, but I don't have dainty little hands.  It'll do the job - but it wouldn't have been my first choice if I was shopping for a mouse on its own. I might go back to my old mouse but I just hate taking up 2 usb ports for a wireless keyboard and a mouse.  We'll see.

text: This keyboard / mouse combination does NOT work with the Logitec Unifying USB dongle.I made an incorrect assumption that a new keyboard / mouse combo would be part of the Unifying system, but it is NOT. title: Bought it for Dad
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on January 29, 2019
text: I Bought combo for my my Dad he has a tangled mess of wires between his keyboard and mouse from the awkward layout of his now confined office space. They have worked terrific once I showed him that if he has papers or anything in front of or over the laser sensor on the keyboard it will not work as well. Once he removed the obstructions it has been working quite well. Literally took me 3 minutes to install and set up. Plug and Play my dad was surprised how quickly it was set up. Just put the usb receiver into one of the usb ports put the batteries in and you are good to go.  I myself have the K330 keyboard and mouse which is a step up from this one and I love it. I've had it for 3+ yrs and works great. Battery life is awesome.

text: I have used workstations and PC's for over 30 years and I just bought my first laptop out of a need for portability.  Boy, did I HATE it.  I hate the touchpad and the keyboard.  I bought a touchscreen model to reduce the regret of buying the thing.  Now, with the investment of a mere $20, I LOVE it.  This wireless combination is the best accessory I could wish for.  Plugged in the USB receiver (1/4") and it worked immediately, true plug and play.  Both keyboards are active, along with both touchpad and mouse.  I also bought an HDMI cable to connect a second display.  I basically replaced the tower with the laptop.  I know I'm not the first person to do this, but I didn't know that it could be done before I bought the laptop. Now, I'm HAPPY!

title: Fine for a great price, but has a lag issue
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2020
text: These pair instantly with every computer I've tried them on with  no fuss, and feel pretty good. I don't think they're super great ergonomically, but for occasional use they're just fine for me. They keystrokes are decently satisfying and the mouse feels very accurate and responsive.The only significant problem is that there is sometimes really intense input lag on the keyboard. It happens across several different computers seemingly at random, but every once in a while it will "save up" 10 or 20 keystrokes and then output them all at once a few seconds later. It's really annoying when it happens, but it's not too frequent and I'm only using this occasionally so it's not such a big deal. I'd be pretty mad if I wanted to use this for gaming or to type very large volumes on all day, though, I think.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Doesn't last - technical issues
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on September 3, 2020
text: Old review (5 stars in August 2020): My old MK270 mouse wore out after y-e-a-r-s of high use. I ordered another brand of keyboard when the MK270s were out of stock, but I hated the other new keyboard (fingers kept tripping over the keys) so I re-ordered this MK270 and I love, love, love it. Works just like my old one. Plug-and-play. Even though the years-old M185 mouse quit (some odd left-click button oddity), I still use the old MK270 keyboard from my last set with a secondary computer.Updated review April 2022 (1 star): My set #2 lasted for about 6 months before the mouse started acting bizarre. It took about a month of jumping through ridiculous administrative hoops for tech support to get them to send me another set (May 2021). The warranty process was so frustrating that I swore I would never buy another Logitech product even though the keyboard layout and feel was perfect for me and I like the mouse size. Set #3 lasted about 6 months as well before acting strange again, and I've been limping along with it for a further 5 months. Today I've finally had the last straw with this set and will be buying from some other manufacturer. Whatever quality I experienced with my first set (bought years before 2020) has been replaced with cheap CRAP! If it had simply stopped working, or worked intermittently, then I could deal with it. But the problem is random twice-clicking (not double-clicking) when you've only clicked the mouse once. So when you're closing one window, it randomly twice-clicks and causes multiple windows to close at the most inopportune times, often discarding all your open work. It's just not worth tolerating its defects anymore.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Disappointing
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 16, 2020
text: I really expected better from Logitech.  I've always thought their products were well made and worked reliably.  But, even as I type this review on the wireless keyboard, I have to hold it nearly upright to get it to type on my pocket pc plugged into my tv.  I stutters and stammers and is not at all drop-out-free as advertised and I'm only about 8 ft. from the pc.  The mouse seems to work reliably, but the whole set is slow and lags a lot, very unnerving and nearly makes it frustrating to work with the pc.  It might work better closer to the dongle, but 8 ft. in my living room chair shouldn't be too much to ask of this product, but clearly it is.  I will be finding a better solution.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black

text: I got this wireless keyboard & mouse and thought I was missing the adapter that makes it wireless. I contacted Customer Service and they immediately sent me a replacement. Again, I THOUGHT I was missing that adapter. Lo and behold it's inserted in the mouse's battery compartment! I had it all along! I wanted you to know where to look for it, if you too think you are missing that part. I think I'll keep both keyboards since it was my mistake & they seem to work really well.

title: This Keyboard is rated to not lag under 10 Meters, It lags at over 2 meters without obstructions.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2021
text: This combo was bought for a computer being used as a media computer. I had to conceal a USB extension cable for the receiver so the keyboard will not lag at just over 2 meters. The keyboard had good tactile response for a membrane keyboard. But the range issue kills the quality of the product. The cheaper keyboard that it replaced had a range that worked from another room. The mouse is a good mouse and does not seem to have any issues what so ever and appears, so far, to be a quality product and is one of the better non-gaming mouse I've used. I would recommend this  for an office application where the desktop or laptop is close to where the combo is being used, but nothing else. It would not be good for home entertainment, power point, or presentation purposes where the computer is more than a few meters away or is in another room.

text: Four stars for the hardware, minus one for really terrible installation instructions.  Per the pictorial installation guide on the packaging:Step 1:  Install USB dongle.I checked the box.  No dongle.  I checked the plastic bag the keyboard came in.  No dongle.  I checked the plastic bag the mouse came in.  No dongle.  I checked the plastic bag the batteries came in.  No dongle.  I double checked everything.  No luck.When I went to put the keyboard back in the package, I glanced at step two of the instructions:Step Two: Remove the dongle from the mouse battery compartment.Fantastic.  I can only hope that the keyboard and mouse were engineered by someone who understands that the second part of a series does not come before the first part.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Poor Engineering.......
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2021
text: After 40 years on a computer of some type, i have never even thought much about a keyboard and mouse as they all seemed to work.... in this case, i simply wanted to change over to wireless, and that part works really well here. But the keyboard doesn't even pass as "operable" due to the bad engineering..... Scrolling up, i see several people asking about certain keys sticking.... well, surprise! They ALL do sooner or later. Essentially the design depends on a "tall" key sliding down a plastic post and, guess what? It soon starts "sticking", but more like, because of poor design, there's enough slop in the fit of those plastic parts that they cantilever and actually jam, not making contact (for me, it's the Space Bar & Enter). I don't know about you, but it's really upsetting to have to proofread everything you type and invariably, there's missing letters, the space wouldn't go down so, words crammed together, yada yada.....  Secondly, do be aware that this is a mini-mouse! if you have large hands, be prepared for cramps in your hands. Also, i still can't get the sensitivity setting working, as in, i have to be precise on borders and sliders.....  Bottom Line: No keyboard/mouse is worth anything if it can't do the basic function of being a keyboard and mouse. So now i search for a decent basic keyboard combo that doesn't cost $274........

This is not your long-term desktop keyboard & mouse, but it would be a good cheap combo for traveling.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Pure junk.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on October 28, 2018
text: I own the Logitech K120 keyboard. I actually think it's fantastic for the price. Fairly stiff keys and a comfortable layout. But I want to get rid of the cables, so I order the Logitech K270 since it's the exact same layout except wireless. Should be 100% passable, right?What a dreadful keyboard. The membrane is so soft it's like typing in a bowl of pudding. Works fine if a bit laggy at 2 feet but not at all at 3 feet. Let me demonstrate by typing literally 3 feet from my tower:This is tst keyWhich translates to "This is the worst keyboard I have ever used," in 2 foot language. Maybe it's unfair since there's a desk and most of the tower in the way. TOO BAD. In rel world, this means a 2 foot range. "Rel" means "real" in 1 foot language apparently.Can't comment on durability. I may update if I decide to smash it out of frustration. No seriously, this is bad. And I've used Inland products. INLAND: the company that tries to make everything everyone else has ever made look good.The mouse--I was already planning on not using the mouse due to lack of side buttons and generally looked like a horrible user experience. Lived up to the every pessimistic guess about it's crappiness. Too small, too light, too slow. But then there's an extra kick in the pants. This does not sync with the Logitech Unified dongle. So if you can even tolerate this travesty of a keyboard but want a different mouse, you're going to need to use 2 dongles.I have a headache from using this product. Dear me, it's bad. So bad. Just don't buy it.

So you will be typing, and there will be a second or two delay before it appears on the screen.  Or you will move the mouse, and there is a good half-second delay before it moves on screen.  This is particularly aggravating if you're presenting in a Zoom call.  I thought it might just be the particular laptop I was using, so I tried it on another laptop and have the same issue.  It doesn't happen a lot, but it does pop up often enough to be a problem in a productivity situation.

title: Come on keyboard, you have ONE job!!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 27, 2022
text: I got this for use in my chair while watching movies from my HTIB. The dongle is about 4 feet behind me, completely exposed for best reception. So, wireless distance issues shouldn't be a problem.Sadly, the keyboard goes into a mysterious "sleep mode" after less than a minute of inactivity. Additionally, it takes anywhere from 10-30 seconds for it to kick back into active mode. Then, it spews out 10-30% of what was previously typed during standby mode, and goes haywire.The "PgUp" and "PgDn" keys don't work at all. The entire NumPad is non-functional.I only wanted this combo for the most SIMPLE of uses. It's not even worth that.That's $20 that would have been better spent on a nice meal somewhere. Oh well. I guess you get what you pay for. It's not even worth the effort to return this mess. I will look for a recycle center and turn it in for a merciful death.The mouse is fine. Obviously, everything about this product is "cheap", so as long as the mouse, like, moves the cursor, I won't complain about (lack of) ergonomics and comfort.

title: The negative reviews were right
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on May 30, 2021
text: I read many of the reviews that complained about this product, but I thought, "How bad could it be?" I found out that the negative reviewers were right. The keyboard works well enough, but if the mouse is more than two feet away from the receiver, the cursor skips and freezes constantly. Very disappointed by Logitech, whose products I had previously found reliable.Update: It's been about six months since I purchased this product. The scrolling wheel on the mouse has become very erratic, and one of the control keys on the keyboard has become non-functional. Troubleshooting with Logitech support did not fix the problems, nor trying various fixes I found on the Internet. To Logitech's credit, Tech Support/Customer Service through its website was very responsive, and they are sending me a replacement set under warranty. If/when that set starts to go, I will be replacing it with a better combo.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: That the USB Reciever is in the F_ _ _ing battery compartment in the mouse.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2019
text: Let's start:  There is nothing in the box telling you where the USB receiver is located.  Of course who would not expect it to be in the battery compartment in the mouse.  Logical. BS!!!  I had Amazon send me another one as I thought these Chinese Mfg's forgot to put one in between lunch break and quitting time.  Ok.  installed the battery on the first mouse.  Usually from previous models you get that little blue light stating its on.  Nope.  Not working either.  Checked battery installation and that was checked.  Luckily, I had Amazon send me another unit when I could not find the first one's USB receiver.  Wish I checked the answers on this page before that, but then again, the first mouse did not work, nor did the keyboard. It just sat there like some Moo Goo Gai Pan.  So I batteried up the second keyboard.  Same thing.  I could not believe I had back to back duds.  Ok, here is where good old fashion yankee ingenuity comes in.  I banged the mouse on top of my desk.  Some how it came to life.  Still no little blue light at the bottom of the mouse.  Maybe it only shows up when the battery dies?  Can't remember  After banging the mouse several times the keyboard caps lock key showed up.  Banging the keyboard did not work. I am now in business.  Of course I have to send the duds back to Amazon.  I may have loosened some sticky rice inside the units circuitry or something.  Who knows?  What fun!

title: What garbage...how is this #1?
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on March 25, 2021
text: I bought this last summer to cut down on the number of USB items I had to hook up to my work laptop. I almost NEVER write reviews, but this has annoyed me so much, I must. The keyboard is fine. Nothing special and does the job. The mouse on the other hand, is absolute garbage. It worked fine for the first 6-7 months, but has recently decided to intermittently drop connectivity. I wished it was a complete drop for a few minutes and then return to normal, however, it drops for nanoseconds, long enough to either double click whatever file I'm trying to move or completely confused when I'm trying to highlight words or links. At this point, I am well past the return window and have to consider this set to be as good as garbage. Will look for another manufacturer because I'm so annoyed in the quality of the mouse/keyboard set.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Stopped working randomly after a month.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on September 15, 2022
text: The dongle no longer is detected and shows up as an unrecognized usb device. So Keyboard and Mouse can't talk to laptop. Using it on an HP Spectre and it was working great for a few weeks. No updated drivers. Tried downloading Logi software and didn't help, the keyboard and mouse don't show up. Tried the USB dongle on a different older computer and it recognized it fine and the keyboard and mouse work on that older device. Couldn't find any support or troubleshooting steps for this issue. I did find it I plugged in a usb 3.0 hub that the dongle would work again even though the hub is plugged into the same usb port that I used the keyboard and mouse in before. Would not buy this again.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Keyboard is okay, mouse is unusable
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on December 15, 2020
text: The keyboard functions well enough. The keys don't feel tight and crisp, but you can get used to it. The mouse is the problem. The logic to detect the mouse being picked up is poor, and it still responds to movement as it is being picked up and moved. For example, if you move the mouse to the left, and you pick the mouse up and move it to the right, the cursor will also move to the right. It is frustrating to the point that it is simply unusable.

title: Works Great 75% of the Time

text: These are great when they're working, but when the keyboard starts lagging it gets a little frustrating. The mouse never has a problem. At times the keyboard starts to lag, and sometimes it takes 5-10 seconds for it to work again. Most times it won't register all the key presses when it starts to lag.On a budget though, overall, it isn't terrible. Every time the keyboard lags, makes me want to throw it out of the window though. Probably wouldn't recommend, but at the price point there probably isn't going to be anything better for wireless.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Works great in both Windows 10 and Linux Mint
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2019
text: I'm quite pleased with this affordable keyboard and mouse combo.  Both items work off of a single USB dongle.  By the way, there were no "written" instructions saying where to find the small USB dongle.  HINT:  It comes stored INSIDE the mouse battery compartment.  The simple drawings on the box did not make that very clear.Otherwise, both have so far (about two weeks) worked flawlessly.  I have a dual boot Windows 10 and Linux Mint 19.1 Cinnamon system.  Both operating systems immediately recognized the keyboard and mouse.  I have no regrets with this cost-effective purchase.

The keyboard and mouse were preventing my new Windows 10 PC from sleeping.After struggling with these issues for months, especially the sleeping issue, thinking something was wrong with Windows,  I decided to swap keyboards/mouse with my daughter and  all of my problems went away!  No lag, and Windows sleeps like a teenager.Logitech,  Get rid of this model.  Its a disgrace to your brand!
