product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: DOA
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on October 14, 2022
text: Tested on two computers, and the keyboard wouldn't work. Tried multiple USB ports, and it picked up 1 out of every 5 keystrokes, with a multi-second delay. I've been a consistent Logitech buyer over the years, and this is the first time I've been disappointed. The keyboard itself feels perfectly familiar and comfortable, and hasn't changed much from the 15 year old wired one I keep as a backup. I definitely assume this is a fluke, or a result of Amazon deciding to ship it without a box, just the flimsy, cereal-box-thickness packaging it comes in. It's no wonder it's dead! I've ordered a replacement and hope it'll work as expected.

title: Works great.

text: I was looking for a wireless keyboard that was small enough to fit on a small desk and this one was perfect. The keyboard and mouse work great. The mouse is just a little smaller than most but I easily got use to it. The keyboard does have some shortcut buttons that work great like volume, home button, calculator, playback and lock. I love the lock button. It’s convenient.  The keyboard and mouse have an on/off switch to save the battery. Battery life seems really good. I haven’t had to change them yet. I’m very happy with my purchase.

text: The keyboard sits up at a comfortable angle and the mouse is not too big for smaller hands to manipulate. It is not too small for larger hands either. Types slightly louder than most with the keys being raised as they are, but that also makes it easy to type for all skill levels. Was very easy to install the batteries in the mouse, as some are very difficult to open without feeling like you're breaking it. Connection was made quickly on both the keyboard and mouse.

title: Nice keyboard and mouse

text: Nice keyboard and mouse but poor product marketing and support.  The MK270 I received is not a unifying mouse/keyboard (no orange square with a star logo).  The biggest problem is that there is no USB extension cord shipped with it and I had connection problems immediately until I used a USB extension cord from an old Logitech mouse/keyboard.  Their chat is no help.  Packaging and available software are very confusing.  But I do like the keyboard and mouse now that I have it working OK.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Keeps disconnecting from Bluetooth
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 19, 2021
text: We have had this exact keyboard/mouse combo for the last several years. Unfortunately, a drink got spilled on the keyboard & ruined it - so we ordered the same combo. We're not pleased with this one. Since the day we started using it - it keeps disconnecting from Bluetooth. We've followed all the troubleshooting steps listed on the Logitec website and it still keeps disconnecting. At this point, we're having to unplug it several times a day to get it started working again. Sometimes just turning it on and off works, but not always. Going to return this, but have to buy another keyboard around town first. Don't buy this until they fix whatever this bug is. Love the feel of the keyboard, but it doesn't work 25% of the time.

title: One key ruins this perfect keyboard
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on September 12, 2022
text: Keyboard manufacturers are always trying to add a hot key that revolutionize keyboards.  On this one they should have left well enough alone.  The keyboard itself is great and I wish I could keep it but they have added one key at the bottom that is like a right click on a mouse.  My hand keeps hitting it during normal typing and the result is unpredictable.  The last time it highlighted everything I had done on Mozilla Thunderbird and DELETED IT!  Fortunately Thunderbird has an undo feature that saved me.  Why did they put this key in?  It's crazy and could cause me to accidentally delete hours of work.  Go figure....

Safe to say this keyboard isn't worth your time or money, since it has the lifespan of about a year and a half. Worst part is, it died mid-email, mid-work day (of course). title: good keyboard but stand broke within a month
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on August 14, 2020
text: This is a great wireless keyboard mouse combo.  Both mouse (1xAA battery) and keyboard (2x AAA battery) use the same wireless connector to the pc.  So you cannot use them separately if you ever wanted to do that.  The reason i gave it 3* is that the mouse is actually a medium sized mouse and not a full size.  Also a month after use, the kickout stand broke on one side - so now I have to use the keyboard without the ergonomically convenient tilt. :(

title: Nope.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on April 11, 2021
text: Usb dongle was not in the mouse like it should've been. Instead it was wedged in the side of the box next to the mouse?  Using the mouse and keyboard was just an awful experience. The keyboard is light and cheap. The keys have 0 weight to them so it feels like you're using a cheap toy. The actual texture is no better the entire keyboard is the same material all grainy. Like coarse plastic it's not nice at all. Typing was difficult but doable. There wasn't any noticeable lag from what I've seen. The mouse was incredibly tiny. If you made a fist this mouse would be dwarfed. The actual make wasn't as bad as the keyboard. The buttons were snappy. Light but not terribly so. It's a mouse. It just didn't work. The movement's were jerky and choppy. Literally unusable. My other keyboard and mouse was $15 less and it worked BETTER than a product recommended by Amazon, and it was made by the same manufacturer. I needed an upgrade because that one is too small for me now but it at least works. Half of this product didn't even work and the other half was terrible to use. If you want something cheap and of quality skip this.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black

text: You get what you pay for.....  Soon after I started using the keyboard the left Shift key began sticking....  I didn't realize the issue initially.....  Never have had this issue & have had Logitech keyboards before... Buy a better quality one.The return process was great.  This time the keyboard/mouse was boxed in another box....  I used that one to return the old...  Very quick return....

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: You ever seen the guy who slams his keyboard on the desk? Yeah that’s me in about two minutes.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on August 14, 2021
text: The mouse is ok but is slow and lags sometimes. The keyboard…. I hate it! It lags so much! It will start by working fine but then all of a sudden it stops. Then it won’t type, then you wait for 2 minutes or change the USB to another outlet on the dongle and wait and then it starts again. Then while you are in the middle of typing an important email busting your butt hustling at 1am and bam! Stops working again. I use it for my home office on two different laptops Mac and HP with a dual screen set up and it does it for both. I have tried everything from putting new batteries, changing the USB port I connect it to, put the dongle with the USB next to the keyboard and nothing works. I remember when Logi used to have great keyboards and mice but I guess those were the old days. I swear it’s so frustrating to waste time on keyboard issues. Don’t waste your money and time with this thing and try something else because you will end up wanting to destroy this thing into a million pieces like me.

title: Good keyboard, not so good mouse
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on January 29, 2020
text: The keyboard is a full sized layout with the 10-key numeric pad to the right. The mouse is complete and utter trash. The mouse is made of extremely light and slipper plastic. There is no forward/back button, including the mouse wheel which only scrolls (no side to side button). The deal breaker is that the on/off button on the bottom of the mouse sticks, so it's difficult to toggle on/off. Better off buying the m225 mouse for ~$15 and a similarly priced keyboard that works with the unifying remote. This kb/mouse combo doesn't work with the unifying remote -- or at least I couldn't get it to.

Glad I saved the packaging. Will return before the 30 day window ends.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Really Disappointed
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2021
text: I have been using Logitech products for 15+ years.  I believe they have a great products that are affordable.  I had to replace my keyboard which got crushed in a move (see pic, top/keyboard).  The model number on the back of my crushed keyboard is K270.  As someone who types pretty much all day for work, type-feel is very important to me.  I kept searching for this K270 model but all that would come up is the MK270 so I figured I would give it a try.  Well, I get the new board and checked the model number on the back and it shows K270 however they type-feel is NOT the same and check out the logo...it says "LOGI" - is it a fake?  How did a fake come in a perfectly sealed Logitech box?  I'm freaking madder the more I write this review.  So frustrating!  Does it work?  Yes, but after a trip to Wally's, they have a whole stack of the exact same model for $19 bucks!  I just feel ripped off and so disappointed in Logitech for doing this.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Failed too soon.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on April 1, 2022
text: At first, the keyboard and mouse were great. The mouse still works well, but the keyboard started acting strange. I would type and nothing would appear, but after an entirely unpredictable period of time (minutes usually), it would suddenly display some of what I typed, and then I'd have to go back and fill in the missing details. Sometimes the keys would repeat so quickly that a momentary press would lead to a dozen characters. Replacing the batteries with brand new batteries didn't help, either. I think a company like Logitech should consider making fewer models of keyboard, and the ones they do make should be reliable so that a keyboard failing prior to the computer it's attached to would be almost unheard of. Clearly, they don't care, because my last logitech wireless keyboard failed after three years, which is too short. This one only lasted 8 months. I replaced it with a different brand, since the next logitech would probably fail after 2 months.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Worst wireless keyboard I have owned
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on November 11, 2020
text: I have owned several Logitech keyboard/mouse combos and have been mostly very impressed with them.  Unfortunately, this latest purchase was an exception.  My main problem with the set is the keyboard.  It seems to go into sleep mode to preserve battery life too quickly and it takes WAY too long for it to wake up start providing input to my computer again.  Like a full 30 - 60 seconds sometimes.  That is in no way acceptable for playing even casual games on and it's even highly frustrating when I just want to do some web browsing.I really and truly get the desire to improve battery life in the device, but it's not worth the cost of wanting to throw it against the wall several times a day while screaming in frustration.C'mon, Logitech.  You're better than this.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Pure garbage
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on October 23, 2020
text: I purchased this combo specifically to reduce desktop clutter. First off, the instructions were non-existent. I had to go online to find something and Logitech referenced buttons on the mouse that did not exist. Second, the USB transmitter would not function from the back of the computer so I had to use up one of the ports on the front. Third, the keyboard was sketchy from the beginning. There were long periods where it just seemed to be sleeping and I just couldn't get it to type. In less than a week, I was back to my wired keyboard. Well at least I had my mouse. Nope, later that same day it started acting up too. Now I'm back to both of my old units. And, the thing that kills me is the good ratings and the cheap price. The good ratings got me to buy it but the cheap price makes it too expensive to return it. I'd have to travel 30 minutes to a place where I could ship it and the trip would cost me more than the thing is worth. So now, in order to buy a decent set of units, I'll have to spend at least $30. I'll be out $50 for a damn keyboard and mouse. I'll just stick with the wired pair.

title: Terrible latency.  Might as well flush 30 bucks down the toilet
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on April 13, 2022
text: Really disappointed in this one.  I've had logitech products in the past and they've been decent.  This mouse and keyboard set is just awful.  about 10% of the time it works perfectly - keyboard types, mouse moves, no latency with either one.  The other 90% of the time, one or the other of them is either not functioning at all or has to be turned off and on multiple times before it will respond at all.  Once it begins responding, sometimes the latency is so bad that it might as well not be on.  Occasionally the keyboard seems to feel so bad about its prior latency that it will start randomly double typing letters and then wears itself out and just stops working completely.I realize the set was inexpensive at 30 dollars.  But it's not usable.  I've replaced batteries multiple times, tried different ports for the wireless receiver, etc.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Not the best purchase I've ever made
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2020
text: I'm on my third keyboard/mouse combo set in 13 months. They all react the same. I can start typing on the keyboard and then realize no characters appear on the screen. Tap on the keyboard several times and then it starts to work. Very frustrating. The mouse is the same way...move the mouse and a long delay before the screen shows the movement. I move the mouse yet nothing shows up on the screen as to where the mouse is located. I have to move the mouse several times before seeing the mouse move or even see the mouse. These issues are intermittent, sometimes it works flawlessly other times I want to throw it out the window. I'm currently using the third combo until I have the time to replace it with another manufacturer.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on June 25, 2020
text: I bought this because I like Logitech and have had good experiences with their products in the past.This mouse and keyboard combo are awful and a complete waste of money.First of all. These devices are NOT compatible with the Logitech unifying receiver. If you're unfamiliar, it is a program/feature that makes it so you can connect multiple Logitech devices to one dongle.I already had a mouse that had a unifying receiver and I was annoyed when I had to use the receiver that came with this unit. ESPECIALLY because the mouse is terrible. The mouse slides around without any drag to it whatsoever. Which means the slightest bump or if you have it on a tilted surface, it slides RIGHT OFF. The lack of any traction makes it almost impossible to do any real gaming or art or video production work.The keyboard feels like it's made from cheap plastic and that I could break by pushing a key too hard. The raised notches on the letters F and J can hardly be felt, so I actually have to look down sometimes to see where my hands are. It's missing controls a lot of new keyboards have.Save your money and buy something a little more expensive with a unifying receiver. This is unusable in 2020 for anything.

title: Will not play with other Logitec products.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on July 26, 2021
text: I have a m510 mouse with unifying remote, with that remote I was able to connect a really old k400r keyboard using the unifying software.  So now to this new product its not unifying, the keyboard will not be detected by the unifying software / dongle.  So I used the dongle provided with this keyboard and there are select keys that are not working regardless of what I've done.  Its consistently having issues with the same keys, its either defective out of the box or just garbage or both. Yes I've removed the working unifying dongle and tested this on different ports, deleted items from device manager etc,...  NONE OF THIS SHOULD BE REQUIRED!!!!!!!In summary the old k400 keyboard that I have which works flawlessly with a different dongle vs this new product has way better key feel than this unit.  The chorded generic mouse and keyboard you get from a Dell feels like better quality than this.  If you have Logitech products already and your using their unifying dongle avoid this garbage.

title: Weak transmitter (piece that plugs into USB port).  Old versions of K270 work better.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on October 29, 2020
text: I have been using a Logitech K270 & M185 wireless keyboard and mouse successfully for many years.  I bought the same K270 wireless combo for my wife's new Dell Inspiron 3880.  Unfortunately the keyboard would only work within about 12 inches of the transmitter.  I returned it to Amazon through Kohl's department store.  That process went very smoothly.  The replacement worked somewhat better but only if the transmitter is plugged into one of the front USB ports!My old Logitech K270 works fine in either front or rear USB port and from across the room!  Clearly, Logitech has downgraded this model over the years.We are still deciding whether to accept this inferior product and live with the 'work-around' or shop for something that actually works.  Recommendations would be appreciated.

title: Not the best quality and frustrating experience
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2022
text: The box looked worn, like it had been shipped in the past. I looked in the battery compartment for the USB receiver, and it wasn't there.So I have extras, and tried them. They wouldn't work, because the devices don't even turn on. I swapped batteries out. No luck.Come to discover that the USB receiver is included in the box, in a box flap of all things. Not in the battery compartment of the mouse. And it's also not a standard Logitech receiver. It's a no-name receiver.The keyboad notes that it's a Logi, and this is an off-brand by Logitech. But I suspect it's a branding effort to keep the Logitech name away from their cheaper product.Recommendation: pay more, get better devices.

title: cheaply made
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2019
text: I've owned two of these now and they booth had similar issues. The first one I bought from bestbuy and the mouse simply died after about two months of daily use, changed the battery with a brand new one and nothing, simply dead, the second set I bought from amazon 9/11/2019 and once again the mouse is having issues as of 12/10/2019 (again,two months later) where it is double clicking things when I only clicked once on the item. the keyboard on both sets that I bought had the same exact issue where it will just randomly shut off, I initially thought this was some sort of 'sleep mode' until it started happening multiple times in a row, when ever this happens I have to wave my hand over the sensor to get it to connect again, and no, its not an issue of the usb sensor being obstructed because the mouse and keyboard is in direct sight of the usb sensor so the signal isn't being blocked by anything, it's just a cheaply made product. just spent a few more bucks and avoid this headache. I can almost guarantee you that all the 4 and 5 star reviews are either from people that work for logitec, people who got paid to write good reviews or a very very few people that actually got lucky and got a non defective product. just stay away. or don't. it's your money and your headache.

text: The keyboard is nice and I really like it at first. Then after a week, I noticed it not being responsive and skipping what I was typing or just not typing at all. This is EXTREMELY irritating when you are using it for work and typing fast. It literally made me have a lot of downtime not to mention frustrated me beyond belief at how poorly it works. I changed the batteries twice and have the key board right next to my PC so its nothing to do with that. Just a cheaply made bad product. I talked to my coworker and later learned that he and another employee had the same issue with theirs which happened to be the same brand and type. So its not a defect, its cheap and not worth the price. i will order a more expensive brand next going forward and returning this immediately.

Sent it back and replaced with a Dell KM7120W which is flawless in the same environment. (the Dell mouse/keyboard are bluetooth as well as 2.4GHz).  I think spending more money is in order.If you are going to use this item sitting 2ft from the PC it may work in your application.  If you are not using 2.4GHz equipment anywhere near this keyboard/mouse, it may work for you.  It is advertised to do far more than it did so the rating is terrible.

title: They Keyboard is a huge piece of junk
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on September 22, 2020
text: I bought this because I'm teaching online and I thought it would make inputting grades and creating online assignments faster to have a regular keyboard and mouse. Since I'm a teacher, I'm also grossly underpaid so I bought this as an inexpensive option. The mouse works fine, just like a mouse should. The keyboard however, is another story. Keys stick, it forgets that number lock is on after pressing one number, making the number pad useless for inputting grades. It's clunky, loud and just absolute trash. The spacebar sticks, its supports are unstable so it doesn't sit flat on a desk... I could go on but the point is, don't buy this, even if you're poor because you're getting a terrible product that isn't even worth its low price.

text: This purchase arrived on 10/08/2020. I needed a wireless combo for my work laptop. The keyboard works just fine and installation was simple. It was pretty much plug and play. However, about a week ago the left mouse button began sticking on me. When I click on something, it stays depressed and I have to tap it extra hard to get it to release whatever I clicked on. Of course when I have multiple tabs open in a browser, it picks up that tab and creates a whole new window. This is the second Logitech keyboard and mouse combo I've owned over the years. My other was nothing but trouble. I really hoped they improved their quality but that doesn't look like the case.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Look elsewhere if you intend to play games with this keyboard.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2019
text: This outdated combo features a keyboard disconnects and experiences delays quite often when using it for gaming, rendering it practically useless for this purpose. Other than that, it seems to work ok... hasn't disconnected once while writing this review.. Mouse works just fine. However, the receiver is not unifying, and logitech's software won't even detect it as a logitech device, which I find very odd, so it seems to work only for these two devices.Mouse is small-ish yet comfortable. Keyboard is light and thin, sometimes feels a bit flimsy but not enough to be a problem. Keys are a bit shallow. The on/off switches on both devices are very cheap and hard to switch. Then again, it's a cheap mouse-keyboard combo so what could we expect.Still, Its flaws make me have to look elsewhere for a keyboard that works for all purposes and doesn't randomly drop/delay when playing games, and ideally with an up-to-date receiver that is compatible with other devices.

title: Does not Work on my Windows 10 Dell

text: I used an older MK270 on this computer for months without a problem.  This new MK270 worked for a minute then completely quit working.  I tried all the normal fixes, no help.  Logitech tech told me to try all the things I had just told them I tried.  They then told me to use the firmware upgrade tool.  It failed to find the USB receiver using two different versions of the upgrade tool.They then said take it back to the store I purchased it from.  Obviously not a something i can do since it was purchased through Amazon.  It is also outside of the 30 day return window.The Logitech warranty information page is currently down so no way to see if they are going to make me send the item back which will cost as much as the item itself.So the keyboard does not work- which is why the one star rating.  The logitech tech kept asking me questions, or to do things that I clearly stated in my first text message that I had done.  I'm not rating the Logitech support but if I did it would not be a four star rating.

text: I had bought the product in anticipation that it would come with a unifying receiver. But it didn’t. 2 months in use and the nano receiver gave up. So, I had to contact Logitech support and they were courteous to send a replacement immediately. So, if you are like me and the thing is broken and also you have exceeded the time limit to return it, don’t hesitate to contact Logitech support. Give them the part number of the product and they should help you get it fixed as these products ship with a one year limited warranty from the manufacturer.

text: The mouse in this bundled keyboard and mouse works really well, and I'm pleased with it. However, about 10 keys on the keyboard simply do not work. It seems clear that this was not a connection issue with the wifi, since it was always the same 10 keys. The keyboard is simply defective. I considered returning the keyboard and mouse, but since I would have to package it all back up, go to a store during COVID, and ship it - and the mouse - back, I can't be bothered, especially for $20. It's still disappointing to buy something that is non-functional out of the package, so I can't recommend this package. You get what you pay for.

title: Mouse and keyboard work intermittently

text: I bought this mouse and keyboard for my computer tray, which sits a few inches below my desk. When the tray is raised to desk level, on the same level as the USB receiver, it works just fine. However, when the tray is lowered to below desk height, connection to the computer quickly drops out or causes an unworkable latency (I would type something and wait 10 or more seconds for it to appear on the screen).Ignoring the functionality issues, the keyboard and mouse construction are about what you would expect for $20. The keys are loose and would work for most work-applications, but I wouldn't recommend it for much else. Definitely a value combo set, don't expect too much.I returned my set after using it for 2 hours due to the functionality issues mentioned above, but if I didn't have a computer tray I would probably have kept it and suffered through.

title: Keyboard Often Becomes Unresponsive
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on September 1, 2020
text: The touch and feel of the keyboard, as well as the general use (ergonomics) are great. The mouse is small which I like for comfort. My problem is just that the keyboard becomes completely unresponsive every 20-30 minutes. Then I have to sit there for 30 seconds and wait for it to work again. This happened with the first keyboard I ordered, to which I returned thinking it was defective. Unfortunately, the replacement I was sent is even worse. The signal is still fine with the wireless portion because the mouse works flawlessly. Its just the keyboard that doesn't work well. For me personally, having an office job that makes heavy use of typing, this is a no-go.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Mostly Garbage
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on May 11, 2021
text: There are a few major issues with this keyboard:1) Lag.  I could not determine the source of the lag, but intermittently as I would be typing my keystrokes would significantly lag, skip or duplicate.  I tried shifting the receiver around on my desktop to eliminate interference but it did not solve the issue.  Online support is very thin.2) The number '8' key on the numeric pad barely works - I have to slam it down hard for it to register.  Poor construction quality, clearly.3) Online support is either confusing or inapplicable.  For instance, having issues with your receiver, download the Unifying Receiver software.  Which I did, and it says I have unifying receiver connected, which can't be true since I'm typing.  Or, try to install a firmware update?  Similar issue - no receiver or device detected.  Refer to solution #1, which creates a circular reference of failure.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Offer stops registering keystrokes. Don’t buy.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 3, 2020
text: Despite the reviews that said the usb receiver would be in the mouse, for me it was in a weird little slot on the edge of the box it came in. (The box was sort of beat up too.) The physical build of the mouse and keyboard is what you would expect for the price. Flimsy and light, but functional.I noticed the big problem after a couple of hours of usage. Two or three times during that duration I would type and none of the keystrokes would register. It’s like it had some process to run (thus blocking the typing) and then it just spammed all of the keys that I typed all at once, once that process finished. I don’t know if this problem was rooted in hardware (an interference issue with Bluetooth devices nearby) or in software (some keystroke logging/batching? That would be shady.) Either way, it makes the keyboard unusable and so I returned it.Don’t waste your time with this kit. Invest a little more money in a nicer keyboard, or test your luck with a different keyboard+mouse.

title: Read instructions and this to make work.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on January 7, 2020
text: I had a problem getting it to work.  In trying to figure out the problem, I opened the mouse to change the battery and saw a plug-in adapter. I removed it and saw that it was not plugged into anything -- it was simply stored there.  If there had been any instructions, then I would have discovered this sooner.  Once I plugged this plug into the adapter cable that I purchased separately, that plugged into the charger connector on my Samsung A20 phone, then magically, the keyboard and mouse insisted on working.  I didn't have to do anything more -- the mouse and keyboard worked perfectly.  Combine this with the Actiontec Screenbeam adapter to mirror my phone to my TV, the TV becomes the monitor.  So, $44 for that adapter plus $22 for the keyboard and mouse and a few dollars for an OTG-type adapter cable -- VOILA! -- my phone is a computer!  My 4K Onn TV from Walmart is a cheap, yet high-resolution 43" monitor for $178 (which I already had).  Who needs a computer?  Your phone already is one! Just add less than $100 in gizmos and gadgets and away you go.

title: Was great until it stopped working and then Logitech would not honor warranty
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2020
text: I have loved this keyboard. When the space bar, 7 key, ; and other keys ceased to function and is still in warranty, Logitech has me talk to multiple technicians, all of whom keep asking me to do the same tasks over again. I have talked with over 3 techs now and they have not read what I have done with the other technicians. It has been over 10 days now of waiting to get approval for warranty replacement (it supposedly has a 3 yr limited hardware warranty) and it does not seem to be coming anymore. They no longer respond to my emails. I have purchased many Logitech items over the years and thought they were a good company, but seeing this lack of honoring their warranty has made me rethink their products and customer service. I will now be referring most of my friends and coworkers elsewhere.

title: Nothing but problems since I received this keyboard...
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 26, 2019
text: If you see typos in this review, it's because this keyboard is the worst wireless keyboard I've ever used. It says "dropout-free" but I must be experiencing drop out all the time because all of a sudden, the keyboard will stop responding and when it does respond it's a garbled version of what I type. Extra spaces...duplicate letters...or it will just stop working all together...it's SO damn frustrating! I've NEVER had this problem with a keyboard EVER before! Did I just get the defective one?! Like...what am I doing wrong? I replace the batteries. I changed which USB port I'm using. I did everything. And YES...I removed the little piece of tape from the battery slot...still not working. This is a piece of crap.Thank God the mouse works, but I am ready to replace this keyboard! Or break it in half with a sledgehammer.

Rep. apologized and stated they would send out another set. Guess what, it was  missing the USB receiver as well.  Since both boxes appeared to be tampered with and I got them off of my porch shortly after delivery I can only assume it was taken either at the plant on UPS driver. There was no packing disquising what the package was so it was easy to see what it was. I was also told someone would pick up the original set which never happened. I had to take it to a UPS office. I did not bother to call about the second set because I  do not have time to make another trip to the UPS office. I will take the loss and purchase a USB receiver. I have had three bad experiences in the past two months and have decided it is not worth going through this.

title: I gave up trying to get it to work with Macbook Pro running Mac OS Catalina
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on July 7, 2020
text: User must install Logitech's control center package (download from Logitech).  But Mac OS Catalina has many security barriers and Logitech's code does not play nicely with those.  It wants access to all keystroke input, to the screen, and to the file system(!).  I tried to grant those but Logitech's documentation was out of data and I could find no way to grant the necessary screen/file permissions.  Also, installation requires several reboots of the Mac.Also, Logitech control center said "no Logitech devices found" despite fact that the mouse was working and the keyboard was sort of working (but things like caps lock, function keys, and other necessities did not work.)Mac OS Catalina works fine with wired USB mice and keyboards without need of any additional software.  It is odd that this product requires so much ancillary software (and even then, it doesn't work.)I gave up.  I will be returning this keyboard/mouse.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black

title: Not the answer - Update!!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 27, 2020
text: I have a computer connected to my living room television and I was hoping to find a better functioning wireless mouse and keyboard. I had been using an older Logitech model, and I had always thought that its inability to work was about range until I read that some models have lag and connectivity issues. So, I searched for a "long range" wireless keyboard and mouse. Honestly, if a company wanted more money for a product that worked, I'd happily pay more. I seriously couldn't find any. So, I bought this one. It works better than the older one, but I still have to wait for it at times. I mean, better than the old one, but it's not the answer. I was able to write this review from my living chair, so 2 stars. Hopefully, if I can make the mouse go to the "submit" button then you'll be reading this!The mouse has gone completely down hill. Please, please, please someone make a decent product for a longer range mouse. I will happily, no, GLEEFULLY pay much more for something that works!!!

title: Junk! Don't buy it - keyboard stops working for long periods of time
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2019
text: I'm highly disappointed as the keyboard often doesn't work. The mouse is fine, but the keyboard will stop working for several minutes at a time. Then will type 1 of the previous letters or a jumble of the letters I was trying to type. Then it won't erase right away as I fight with it. Since I'm currently unable to sit at a desk and need a wireless keyboard I'm very frustrated. 2 stars because the mouse works but would have been only 1 star and a return otherwise. I can't get out to do a return as I can't walk or drive for several weeks. I expected so much better from Logitech as I've used their products for years.Update: Had this now 1 month. Downgrading to 1 star. Keyboard with fresh batteries and it still didn't type for the last 10 minutes. Tapping keys waiting for it to work. It finally typed 2 letters then stopped again. Total junk. I've ordered a keyboard extension cord for my regular keyboard and will be tossing this when it arrives. What a waste.Writing review using my phone.

title: Poor reception
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on June 22, 2020
text: The keyboard only worked when less than a meter from the receiver. Not a problem under normal circumstances, but the thickness of my desk was enough to make the signal intermittent, with constantly dropped or mis-registered keypresses. I'm a bad enough typist on my own, and don't need help. Add to that that sleep mode was so latent, I would often hit a key, think it wasn't working, hit it a few more times, then, as I attempted to move the keyboard, a dozen kepresses would register.  I switched back to my old keyboard (also a Logitech wireless) after two weeks.

title: No more Logitech
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2019
text: So it's a $20 keyboard/mouse. You get what you pay for. Bought the set last March, used it for a couple of weeks while I was waiting for my business laptop to be set up, then pulled the batteries and put it away. I don't use my PC that much-- mostly it's the laptop. Anyway, needed the PC the other day, put in fresh batteries and---nothing. Won't turn on. Went through all the troubleshooting steps, still nothing. Tried to contact Logitech warranty support and that's when a three star "worked well for a while but you get what you pay for" review went from a three to a one star. Finding website warranty support is almost impossible. Leave the message, someone will get back to you. That was three days ago and haven't heard from Logitech. Well, they won't be hearing from me any more either. I've bought and used Logitech peripherals for years. They used to be top of the line (still have some that are ten years old) but I've noticed that, over the past few years, their quality seems to have gone downhill. Oh, well. There's other manufacturers.

title: The mouse is terrible in this set
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 17, 2019
text: I purchased this to replace a similar Logitech set (that was 2.5 yrs old) as the mouse was no longer working consistently and the keyword was sometimes not registering key strikes.After a month, maybe two, the mouse in this new set started getting finicky, sometimes freezing up on the screen or suddenly bouncing around on its own. It's the same problem I started to have with my prior mouse so I thought it might be my computer or mousepad...I tried a mouse from Amazon Basics to see if that worked and it does - flawlessly. So the problem is definitely the Logitech mouse.They keyboard is fine. I like that the surface and keys are matte, so they don't show finger prints like a Microsoft keyboard I used in the past.I won't be buying Logitech again as a keyword/mouse should last longer than a couple months or be higher quality than this. Compared to the Amazon Basics mouse the Logitech mouse craftsmanship does feel quite cheap....hard to describe but bouncing between the two you notice the difference.FYI, these come with batteries, which wasn't expected.

location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 16, 2019
text: I purchased 3 of these sets for our office because we have had several Logitech products both at work and  home and have always been very happy with their products.  However, the keyboard and mouse set that I have been using for the last couple of weeks is awful.  The keyboard keeps lagging constantly and also becomes unresponsive until I shut it off and turn it back on.  This is extremely disappointing and frustrating for someone who types 80% of their work day.  I tried to find a customer service email address to send a complaint to Logitech but was unable to find one.  This is definitely going to make me reconsider purchasing from this brand in the future, both for work and home.

I of course assumed the problem must be caused by something else. For one year I changed settings, changed USB ports. Finally I just gave up and bought a Microsoft keyboard. PROBLEM SOLVED, period. I don't know, don't care, the new Microsoft keyboard and mouse works great.

title: Keyboard is lagging

text: After few months of moderate usage, the keyboard started lagging. I changed the batteries, and the port on which the receiver was plugged but I still get the same problem. When it freezes, I gotta wait for 2-3minutes. It does not matter whether I turn it off and turn it back on. I tried using the  Logitech firmware update tool but it won't detect the receiver. I uninstalled and reinstalled the keyboard drivers driver. Naaada. Tried reaching out to Logitech Support Team. They take email support only. No email address is listed on the support page of the product. And so on... My advice: STAY AWAY FROM THIS CHEAP PRODUCT.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: You'll be sorry!!!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2021
text: The mouse was often erratic, sometimes would not work. Same for the keyboard.  How could somethings so simple screw up? I tried many suggested remedies. I thought it was the computer. Then I saw some posts saying RF cross talk transmitted from internal components of the computer had been found to create the problem. The solution would be to add an extension cable for the USB wireless module to get it away from the PC chassis. I bought the wireless keyboard/mouse to get away from wires!!!  I got got a 3 foot cable and it seems to work. The jury is still out.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Should have read the reviews.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2020
text: How this thing has so many positive stars is beyond me.Laggy and can be completely unresponsive to start.  I use this at my office for data input and web surfing.  I can type a sentence or address half of them show up, sometimes none.  Then I have to plug and unplus and turn them all on and off again to try and reset it.  I've switched the usb dongle to the front of the pc, the back and also tried a USB hub that sits within inches of the keyboard and mouse.  I've tried downloading the new firmware, which won't install since it says I don't have a connected device(which I find funny).  Deleted the device, tried letting windows update the driver....you know the drill!  Then by some sheer miracle, the thing starts working normally like now....as I type this review.It's enough to drive you crazy!  Spend a little more money, I will after I'm done here!

title: You don't get what you pay for.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2021
text: Despite this mouse/keyboard being "economical", its still not worth the price. Both the keyboard and the mouse lag to the point of seriously effective usability. Not just missed letters or a lag here and there. They actually become unusable at times. Sporadically for 1 or 2 minutes, multiple times throughout the day, The keyboard will miss entire words and the mouse will skip all over the screens trying to keep up.I'll reach over the keyboard and mouse pad on my laptop and they both work perfectly.I've used logitech for a VERY long time but this product missed the mark.PS - it does this on my dell and my surface pro.

text: I bought this keyboard and mouse and it was easy to install (plug and play); that is about all the good I have to say about it. Not even into using it for a week, the up arrow (just to the left of the '0' key on the keypad) fell out. I keep having to put it back into place, but it falls out again. For $20 beware--you get what you pay for. I do all the IT Procurement at my company (large, international company) and I will not be buying this keyboard for any of my offices. It is too bad, Logitech has some good products but this is not one of them. I am not sure if I should return it or just eat the money spent.

I gave 3 stars since I got the new keyboard and figured out it did not work well with usb 2.0. It is fine if I inserted the little connector into usb 3.0. My desktop has all usb 2.0 in the back.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Stay Away!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2021
text: Having used a wireless keyboard and mouse for many years, and in need of a replacement, I decided to replace a Logitech Wave kb/mouse combo with this to save a few bucks. Bad decision. I have never had a wireless keyboard and mouse with more latency, lag, and drop then this. I'll have to wait, sometimes, a full 15 seconds between tapping a key or moving the mouse and having anything happen on the screen. I'll be using the mouse, and watching the pointer skip around on the screen whilst mousing over a smooth surface. All of this while six whole feet from the receiver. This set is an unmitigated pile of junk. Latency and drop issues aside, I have average to slightly below-average sized hands, and the keyboard is almost too small for me to use. Spend the extra cash and buy something better.

title: Truly bad
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on November 11, 2020
text: I've been a Logitech fan for a long time; they're  my go-to for just about any peripheral device. So, when I was looking for a wireless keyboard/mouse, this was my first stop. I ignored the bad reviews, trusting my past experience and expecting Logitech to over-deliver, as usual. That was a mistake: believe what everyone else is saying about the insufferable reception quality. I have reconfigured my work station, getting the keyboard a direct, unobstructed line of sight to the Bluetooth receiver, still to no avail. I am getting flashbacks from the 90s, when I would walk uncooperative remotes directly up to the TV or VCR and try mashing the buttons from an inch away (of course refusing to use the face controls, since that would be admitting defeat). Hard to believe for what is otherwise functioning hardware, but this keyboard/mouse combo isn't even worth the $24 they're charging.

title: Not what I expected
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on July 10, 2020
text: This is a review of the Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard and Mouse Combo.  I received the combo, inserted the batteries and receiver, and was up and running in minutes.  I immediately noticed that the mouse wheel emitted a scraping sound when I turned it from rubbing against something inside.  I have another Logitech mouse and it's smooth as silk.  The keyboard was a bit larger than I expected but it was OK.  The keys were OK and functioned well.  After a few days of using the combo, the mouse started to not track correctly on screen.  I thought perhaps the battery needed replacing which I did but the issue continued.  I checked the underside and found that the emitter was not showing a light like my other Logitech so I assume there was something amiss there.  I cleaned it, and played with the battery connection a bit, but nothing helped so I returned it.

title: Throwing away
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on May 9, 2022
text: There are far few things more frustrating than the lag on this keyboard. I love the keys, the size, everything about it but the sleep feature will have you ready to rip your hair out. I will use it, move over to write something down and then come back over to start typing again and it can take anywhere from 2-4 minutes to finally register that I'm pressing keys. Throwing it away and hoping I can find another that looks exactly the same, but without the nerve wrecking lag time.

title: Keyboard and mouse FAULTY
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on November 8, 2020
text: First of all it was not new. It was used but that was not specified. Manufacturers, even if it is a top brand, if they are sold independently MIGHT not be handled the same was, in this case, LOGITECH, the same as if purchased from them directly. LOGITECH.That is number 1 problem. There were batteries left in the unit, both keyboard and mouse. This proves it was used.Forgot to turn off, also. Dangerous. I put in new batteries...off/on no go. All in all it was not presented to ME correctly....I just got the LEMON of a deal....not that all people do.  BOX crushed, etc. When I sent back to them I packaged it better then they did when it was sent.  This is a GOOD habit of mine....spend lots of money on SCOTCH shipping tape. cc: JEFF BEZOS

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Dangerously frustrating
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 25, 2020
text: If you're looking for something that will frustrate you until you want to smash it, this is the product for you. Just when you think it's working...nope. Start typing and letters appear...but wait, then they don't. And sometimes 10 seconds later they appear. And sometimes they just never appear at all. I have the receiver plugged into my laptop a mere 15" away, so it cannot possibly be a distance issue. If it didn't work at all it would have been a blessing, because I would have returned it immediately. However, this thing works just enough to lure you into a false sense of security, before it starts messing with your soul. After 3 days of being driven completely insane, I did my household a favor and returned it before I got to the point of smashing it over my desk. Make no mistake--if you use this for too long you will absolutely smash it against a very hard surface.

title: UNUSABLE DUE TO LAG
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on November 22, 2019
text: Ordered a wireless keyboard for my desktop to replace my wired one which was wearing out.  This came with both keyboard and mouse which were both receivers from the single usb transmitter.  (I already had a cordless mouse which was working well.)  I have used Logitech for ages because I have always had good experience with their products.  This was a Big Disappointment.  The lag time was terrible.  I would type a few letters and see nothing on my screen, then type a few more and all of a sudden they would all show up.  The mouse skittered around and would freeze for a second before resuming motion.  I did not have this issue with the wireless mouse (also Logitech) I had been using.  I can't imagine anyone being able to cope with this issue.  After 15 minutes I was exceedingly frustrated.  It's going back.  Not sure I'll even try another.  This was AWFUL!

title: Steer clear of this product - Keyboard stopped working completely after 7 weeks.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on June 1, 2020
text: Had some issues when I first purchased in mid April. June 1st the keyboard stopped working completely after a week of it intermittently losing connection and half the keys working. Additionally, batteries that came with it did not work and this thing burns through brand new batteries, leading to having them replaced 3x in less than 2 months. This item works with one USB unit for both the mouse & keyboard, which in my opinion may have lead to it's connectivity issues. Both are basic design. Mouse hasn't given me any issues.Definitely find another product. Nothing is more frustrating than trying to work from home and your keyboard crashing on Monday morning. It's not worth the lost hours. Very disappointing.Attempted to return, but Amazon's return window was May 31st for a mid April purchase. Which I found very odd. Just my luck, the keyboard finally crapped out the day after the window closed. Woe is I.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Does not work and Logitech support has not responded after 4 days
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on March 20, 2020
text: I have used USB wireless mice in the past, so knew the basic set up of placing the wireless USB transponder in the computer to send signals to the mouse and keyboard.  It would have been nice for a novice if the box diagram mentioned somewhere that the little USB transponder was tucked inside the battery cavity of the mouse.  Regardless, I tried 3 different sets of batteries and two different laptops and cannot get any movement of the mouse or strokes on the keyboard to register.  I contacted Logitech support on 3/16 and have only received a case number (same day), but no reply about sending a new USB or whether this MK270 combo set should be returned.  I hate to do returns if there is an easy fix (do not want this going to some one else or being junked, if not necessary) but do not want the box leaning against my desk too many more days...... Bummer.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Junk, Like all Logitech wireless keyboards and combos I have ever tried.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on January 10, 2019
text: I have tried a various wireless mouse and keyboards from Logitech over the years on numerous systems and they always have the same connection and dropout problems. This MK270 I have tried before on both Intel and AMD system with no luck but it had been a few years, I figured surely they had got their act together by now. I decided to try again on my newest AMD system and the KB is literally under two feet from the receiver and it is losing connectivity constantly and getting worse. Had I read deeper into the reviews I would have avoided it.While it may work fine for you if you have no expectations, if you are gaming or anything where you need constant connection like fast typing you better leave it at Amazon on the shelf. It will lose connectivity for many seconds at a time and not respond at all...As always it seems to always affect the keyboard rather than the mouse.Find something else...

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Keyboard became sporadically unresponsive
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on October 19, 2020
text: This keyboard worked for months without issue but recently has become sporadically unresponsive. I have put in new batteries, changed where the dongle was plugged in, tried updating and reinstalling drivers, restarted the computer, turned the keyboard on/off. It will be working fine and then without warning stop responding, and none of the fixes mentioned above consistently make it start again. It seems random and it is infuriating. The mouse doesn't have this problem, just the keyboard.

title: Mouse / Keyboard lag
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 17, 2019
text: I think the USB dongle has a poor signal strength.  When it was plugged into the back of my monitor, the keyboard and mouse would often lock up.  When moved to the side of the monitor, it was a little better, and when I tested moving my keyboard and mouse right next to the dongle it seems to work great...I think I need to order a 1 foot USB extension cable for the dongle.[Updated] . After trying out a USB extension cable for the dongle so that the wireless stick is only 1-2 feet directly in front of my keyboard and mouse, there seems to be a slight improvement, but overall, the quality is terrible, so I'm dropping to 1 star.  I think the problem is only on the keyboard side, but it regularly loses connection or buffers the input.  If I just wait a few seconds, the keyboard comes back by itself, but it's basically unusable this way.

title: Has a annoying "insert" key.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on October 24, 2019
text: I'm finding this keyboard useless.  It has an "insert" key that is not just useless, but is maddening when I accidentally hit it trying to press "delete" key, which I do all the time.  All the sudden I'm typing over text, rather than inserting.  I get that maybe 1 in 1000 people might want this feature, but to place it such a prominent position is really poor design.  I guess I'll keep it as a backup keyboard since it's not worth the trouble of sending back, but beware unless you're somebody who needs an "insert" key!

Didn't matter where the receiver was at- within a foot of the keyboard and plugged directly into the front of the tower or 3 feet away with the tower on the floor, plugged into the back. The mouse never had an issue, always stayed responsive. The second one, the replacement, seemed fine at first, but after 2 months has started dropping out frequently as well.

location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on December 14, 2020
text: Absolute, NO questions-asked TERRIBLE.  Terrible functionality.  Terrible reliability.  Constant intermittent connectivity a mere 3 feet away from the wireless USB connector.  I can't believe big companies can produce such unreliable junk.  From day-one I fought with that frustrating 1/2 second delay between hitting a key and seeing it show up on the screen.  Ever-so-slight... but just a little frustrating.  Not even three months later... useless.  Completely useless.  The sad part is that THIS keyboard was bought because I was disappointed trying to save money with off-brand solutions.  After two of those, I figured Logitech would certainly be the way to go, right?  NOPE!  I'm sure they're all made in the same factory somewhere.

text: This keyboard would be fine except for one TERRIBLE design flaw. Just above the function keys are a row of buttons for quick access to volume control, mail, etc. Unfortunately, as circled in the picture,  there is a button that immediately powers off your computer! If you BARELY graze that button - instant power off. I am right handed and the number of times I've accidentally bumped the key is infuriating.  It is a terrible design.  Also, the mouse that comes with this keyboard is TINY. Not useable for an adult.  Maybe good for a very small child. Super disappointing purchase.

title: This gives lag a whole new definition!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on April 19, 2020
text: I wanted a wireless setup for when recording mixed reality, so I didn't feel I needed anything high end. I went with Logitech because I have never had a bad experience with their products. Boy was I in for a treat. I can have the keyboard literally on top of my tower with nothing open except file explorer to rename a file and I can type a 6 letter word then leave the room to grab a drink and come back to watch it pop it up as I come back in. Even worse than that is that 3/4 of the time it will either leave out some of the keystrokes completely, input them in a random order that is different than typed or most often it is a combination of both. I wouldn't give them about $3.50 for it!

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Sent without the USB dongle...to replace the same item that was sent without the USB dongle
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on August 10, 2021
text: So, I don't know if this is Logitech's fault or Amazon's fault but this item was sent without the USB dongle (the little thing you plug into a USB port so that the wireless keyboard and mouse can talk to your computer). Thing is, this is a replacement of the same item I ordered...and received without the USB dongle. Apparently, this item does not come with the one item that makes the wireless keyboard and mouse usable. And then, when you return the item that does not work, you end up getting a refund...less the restocking fee. What a racket.

location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2020
text: EXCEPT, this is the second set I've purchased in the last eight months.  WHY?  Because the keys start sticking.  On the first one, the CTRL key was permanently stuck.  On my new one, the ESC key is now sticking, after only three weeks of use.  WTH?  FYI, I clean my keyboards daily, have clean hands, and store enclosed when not in use.Now, it's been three months, more and more key are sticking.  If you only use a keyboard occasionally, this one should be fine.  However, the durability is in serious question x two time ordered.  Now worth even the cost-effective price.  If I was going to have to sacrifice quality, I should have been warned.

title: Issues after a month of use
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2020
text: If you need an inexpensive keyboard for about a month, this is the perfect keyboard for you.If you want a keyboard that works for longer than a month, look elsewhere. Right around a month of use this keyboard started showing connection issues. I'll go to type, get about four words in and notice that it hasn't typed a single thing. I'll power it on and off and move the USB dongle to another port, I'll be able to type for a bit, but then the issue continues. I'm literally two feet away from the dongle with no obstructions.So if you like keyboards that go bad right after the return policy expires, this is the keyboard for you.The mouse works great.

title: Scam... arrived without any Bluetooth dongle TWICE.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 17, 2020
text: I like Logitech products. I've been using them for the better part of a decade. I've probably bought about 5 or 6 of the MK270 exact model over the years, for different offices and home office setups. This might be the last time I give this company a dime.The first order arrived with keyboard, mouse,  and batteries, but with no bluetooth dongle to actually, you know, use them. Frustrating, but not the end of the world. I contacted Amazon for a replacement.Same exact thing the second time. There is nothing else in the box. I've turned it over and shaken it. It's not hidden in with the batteries. It's not under a cardboard fold somewhere. It's just a keyboard and mouse, two unusable hunks of plastic.Save your time and frustration.

text: I touch type without problems on multiple and various keyboards -- from Mac and Windows laptops to bluetooth and wired keyboards. This keyboard gave me problems from the beginning. You need to download a settings program from Logitech. That program fails to start on Windows 10 Pro, so it's useless to me. I'm returning this keyboard and mouse for a refund.

So I gave them a chance again and the keyboard and mouse lasted about 8 months...and started acting up again. Now I am swearing off Logitech for good. Their peripherals are not what they used to be and that makes me sad. Your mileage may vary but as for me, I'm done.

title: Do NOT buy! What a waste of time and money
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on May 17, 2020
text: I chose this over some cheap chinese model. A name brand product I was familiar with.  I just needed something without lag for typing and typical mouse movement. Not gaming or anything of that sort of precision. This was a dead man joke at a funeral. Absolutely uncalled for.  When I unboxed it and compared it to another logi keyboard, the plastic was cheap and inferior. The mouse felt unusually light but I connected and see how it went. It lasted 2 minutes before I reconnected my wired components. I am extremely annoyed that I trusted Logitech and this was shipped directly from them. I could have possibly got over how cheap the product felt. But the lag from both keyboard and mouse made it unusable.  Disgusting work from a major company.

I am pretty mad that I wasted money on this junky item

Now, it just doesn't recognize anything.My computer is new(ish), works perfectly and has not had any other problems with any USB port. I plugged my husbands different keyboard/mouse bluetooth device into the same computer and USB port and they worked perfectly. I switched the batteries in the keyboard and mouse multiple times, they were new and working fine. It was just this device that didn't work.

title: Very Frustrating Keyboard and Mouse Set...
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on May 19, 2020
text: It's not always true, but on this one, you get what you pay for. The keyboard is super glitchy and not very reliable. Super frustrating to type out three sentences, look up and realize that half of what you typed was actually captured. The keyboard, in particular, has to be right next to the receiver to even work... I am a corporate trainer by trade, and the mouse is TERRIBLE to "draw" on the screen. It seems as if the laser on the bottom of the mouse is on the wrong side.One other note: The receiver is NOT a unifying receiver. Meaning you will NOT link other keyboards and mouse to it, and this keyboard and mouse will NOT link to other receivers. Very frustrating!

title: The Most Frustrating Keyboard functionality
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2021
text: The reasons I rated this Logitech Keyboard with one star:The functionality of this Logitech Keyboard is terrible.  As I use the keyboard, it responds very slow with the actual keystrokes, including missing letters in the beginning, requiring to erase and start over.  (I am an average speed keyboard typist). I replaced the batteries with Keyboard & Mouse, when I first started using this Logitech keyboard, thinking that perhaps that was the issue. New batteries did not resolve the issues.Most of the time, I change over to the Surface keypad.My lesson learned. Though the reviews were pretty good : no more inexpensive or Logitech keyboards.

location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2020
text: I was disappointed with this product.  The keyboard isn't as quiet as I expected, but the most surprising thing was that the mouse wheel isn't smooth to operate: you can feel the clicking in your finger, which doesn't seem like a big deal but it's annoying and unnecessary.  I don't know if mine is slightly defective, but if not and I'd known about this it would have been a deal breaker for me.

title: Intermittently stops working OFTEN
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on September 13, 2020
text: I've replaced the batteries multiple times, tried moving it extremely close to the USB receiver, turning it off and on... nothing seems to consistently fix this thing. The issue is that every once in a while (often at least a couple times per day), the keyboard will just "decide" to stop working. Press keys, nothing happens. When this happens, I try a bunch of things to try to get it functioning again like turning it off and on, taking out the USB receiver, etc. and generally after a minute or two it will usually start working again. But, this whole process ends up interrupting me in the middle of work often. When the keyboard works, it's great. Unfortunately, it often doesn't.

title: Problems after less than one year

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Another Logitech failure
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on August 16, 2020
text: I'm writing this review on my spare wired keyboard as the Logitech is no longer work. After 8 months it no longer responds for seconds at a time and then randomly picks which letters it wants to add to my text. I have restated the computer several times and replaced the batteries twice. Yesterday, the mouse cut out too. I wish I could say this was the first problem I have had with Logitech, but it's more like the 5th. Their hardware is OK, but the unifying software always does something to make my life miserable, usually with mice. I think I'll stick with Microsoft wired keyboard from here on. Granted the combo was cheap, but you get what you pay for.

title: Piece of JUNK! Waste of money!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2020
text: Not precise, and response is VERY spotty. I struggle to use the mouse because the cursor would jump all over the place for no reason. The cursor would also disappear most of the time. When I drag the mouse the cursor would get stuck in one place, move, get stuck, again and again, very FRUSTRATING!!! The left and right click doesn't respond most of the time, same goes with the keyboard, some of the keys are not responding. Using this keyboard and mouse is similar to using a more pricey one with 2% battery life left. Oh yes, I use brand new batteries with 100% life, to no avail. mouse pads? I tried it with 4 different ones, still Nada.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: This thing sucks.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2020
text: I had bought an identical looking Logitech keyboard and mouse combo about 5 years ago, so I disregarded the bad reviews and bought this anyway. The old one never gave me any problems and I beat the heck out of it before the mouse finally started going. This one is giving me the same problems as other reviewers have mentioned. It's not being recognized and it happens often. Go to type something and get nothing. Then randomly smashing buttons until it starts to work, or turn it off and on then press buttons repeatably to get it to acknowledge. I don't understand how something that is essentially a newer version of a product that has been perfected for years could suck so much.

product_name: Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard And Mouse Combo For Windows, 2.4 GHz Wireless, Compact Mouse, 8 Multimedia And Shortcut Keys, For PC, Laptop - Black
title: Very poor connectivity
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on February 6, 2019
text: I purchased this same model several years ago and was very pleased with it. No problems and the battery life was great.This one, however, is a very different story. The connectivity is very unreliable as sometimes there are no problems and other times it's a complete nightmare trying to do anything. Typing lag and mouse lag make it incredibly frustrating to do anything. Often times the keyboard will stop typing mid sentence, lag, then catch up and insert several random characters at the same time. Meanwhile the mouse will freeze mid screen on and off enough to drive any normal person to madness.I'm not sure what Logitech did with this product but it's nowhere near the reliability and quality I expected. I'll be going a different route very soon

title: DOESN'T WORK

text: I was sent a refurbished keyboard. Keyboard and Mouse did not have strip to pull out before putting batteries in.  Initially only the key board worked. I had a friend who works on computers check keyboard and mouse, he agreed, said this was a used one, ONE that does not work.  I am not returning because it will cost me shipping, especially with the size of the box for the key board.  I will go to Best Buy to get one, at least i can inspect it before i buy.  Totally disappointed with this purchase.

So now I have a useless keyboard and mouse that I now have to go through the trouble of sending back so I can get a refund. So frustrating. DONT BUY. You’ve got a 50/50 shot you’ll get your SD card.

text: The keyboard and mouse work fine within 1-2 feet of the USB dongle. My recommendation is find something higher quality with a stronger connection if you need true wireless capability.

title: Keyboard does not work!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2020
text: The keyboard that shipped (K270) is not compatible with the mouse that came packaged with it.  The mouse (and bluetooth adaptor) use the "Unifying" protocol.  They work fine, however the keyboard does not.  I spent way too much time searching the internet for a solution, and Logitech clearly doesn't monitor their own forums.  I don't understand how they can package these products together and get away with it.  Had I tried using the keyboard in the first 30 days I received it, it would have been promptly returned to Amazon.  Now it's going in the garbage.

title: Buyer beware!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2020
text: Based on the reviews this keyboard has received it seems that you can expect to receive a keyboard and mouse that work as expected or a keyboard and mouse that are unresponsive and laggy. Unfortunately I received the latter.This particular combo performed poorly on three different laptops that I tested them on. The cursor moves about a second or two after moving the mouse and anything I typed would appear on the screen about a second or two after typing.It’s really surprising because I’ve owned two other Logitech wireless mouse/keyboard combos that worked really well.Fortunately, Amazon allowed me to return it for a full refund.

title: Loud and uncomfortable
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2020
text: Advertised as a quiet keyboard; this is far from quiet. Ordered this to replace my older Logitech keyboard which was a workhorse and not completely silent. In comparison, the older keyboard and mouse were silent... this keyboard sounds like a typewriter, the mouse scroll wheel sounds like sandpaper on plastic, and the mouse clicks are very tingy clicks. Horrible device for video conference note taking. Very uncomfortable angle too, even with the feet propping it up.Along with the horrible noise, the box was sent completely exposed and arrived opened, damaged, and paperwork was missing. Returning and ordering something actually silent.

title: Stopped working just outside of 90 day support period
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2019
text: I bought this product on April 15, product support window closed on July 16. Today is August 4 and the keyboard is often non-responsive. Mouse works fine, but the keyboard completely stops working and then starts working again (then you think it fixed itself and stops working again). I tried turning on and off, replacing the batteries, etc. It doesn't work. But outside of the 90 day window so Amazon says to contact Logitech-- which is sure to be a pain. I guess I should've expected a cheap keyboard to work poorly. I cannot recommend buying this, better to save yourself the trouble and spend a little more and buy one that actually works.

text: I normally don't write reviews, but I'm extremely disappointed with this wireless keyboard. I noticed a little bit of lag right after I bought it, but at the time I was multitasking and thought the issue was due to my PC memory.  But here I am with nothing but Amazon open and it's still causing problems.  For what it's worth the mouse portion works fine.  Overall I definitely do not recommend purchasing this item.  Save yourself some major headaches and purchase a different keyboard and mouse set.

text: I’ve tried using this on a MacBook, an iMac, and two different PCs. It doesn’t matter how close to the Bluetooth connector you are, you’re not getting both the mouse and keyboard working at the same time.A typical use case involves minutes of trying to get the mouse to work. The second it starts responding, the keyboard then will lose connection so then it’s some more minutes getting the keyboard to work. Then it just becomes a fun game of guessing how long they’ll work before shutting off again and having to start the process all over again.

text: This is a cheap product. The Bluetooth constantly disconnects, the keyboard is loud, and the mouse is too small.
